title: XSUM-35862185:llama70b-ul2
source:
England failed to build on the optimism generated by their thrilling victory in germany as they were beaten in a friendly by the netherlands, who have not even qualified for euro 2016.
On a night when wembley paid its respects to the late dutch legend johan cruyff with applause in the 14th minute, a much-changed england side slipped to a rare defeat at the national stadium.
Man-of-the-match jamie vardy rounded off a slick passing move to steer in kyle walker's cross four minutes before the interval - but roy hodgson's side could not protect their lead.
England's defence lived on the edge too often and were eventually punished when a sloppy passage of play led to danny rose handling, and vincent janssen scored from the spot after 50 minutes.
The big striker was then too strong for substitute phil jagielka, although england complained bitterly he had been fouled, before crossing for luciano narsingh to score the winner 13 minutes from  time.
Vardy's transition from the heights he has scaled with leicester city this season to england has been seamless - and he has stepped up a level in the two friendlies against germany and the netherlands.
The 29-year-old has been portrayed as both an ideal starter and the perfect impact substitute as hodgson makes plans for euro 2016.
Vardy has proved his capabilities for both, with an explosive 20-minute cameo in berlin that included a brilliantly instinctive finish as part of england's comeback.
And here, he was england's outstanding performer by some distance, showing the pace and energy that has panicked premier league defences and also skill to round off that passing move with a clinical finish before testing dutch keeper jeroen zoet with a powerful rising drive.
The debate about how best to use vardy may go on but one thing is beyond dispute - he is going to euro 2016 and has the ability to threaten every defence in france.
In an ideal world, everton's john stones would have come in at wembley to produce the sort of elegant display that became his trademark in the early seasons of his career, thus cementing his place alongside chris smalling for england's first euro 2016 game against russia in marseille.
Instead, wembley witnessed a 21-year-old whose confidence has been hit by a recent dip in form at club level and will need a little renovating before the serious action gets under way.
Stones twice brought murmurs of concern from england's fans inside wembley with his tendency to perhaps over-play out of defence, but his determination to be constructive also started the passing move that led to vardy's goal.
The young defender is a work in progress and there will be slips - quite literally when he stumbled at the start of a chain of events that led to england keeper fraser forster having to save well from janssen before rose handled to leave the striker to score from the spot.
Stones is well worth persevering with - but hodgson must hope some of that confidence and composure returns quickly.
Hodgson warned they must not get carried away after victory in germany - and, in case anyone ignored the warning, along comes a defeat against a dutch team that will not even be in france this summer.
In some respects this defeat, albeit with a much-changed side, simply reinforced some of the lessons that came out of the win in germany that was the catalyst for such a surge of optimism.
England have some very exciting options up front in the shape of vardy and harry kane, while daniel sturridge also got a decent 57 minutes under his belt.
Questions remain, however, about a frail-looking defence with both full-back spots still up for grabs and no central-defensive pairing jumping out as hodgson's first choice at this stage.
England certainly carry a threat but fears persist about their ability to resist attacks of the highest calibre.
Fraser forster: solid night for the southampton keeper despite a couple of fumbles.
Saved well from georginio wijnaldum and vincent janssen.
Clear deputy to joe hart.

7.

6.
John stones: not a great night for everton's 21-year-old.
Yes, his determination to play started the move for england's goal but too often caused anxiety with his tendency to overdo things and second-half slip started chain of events that led to the dutch equaliser.
5.
Danny rose: not an easy night for england's defence but rose kept going and may consider himself unlucky to be punished for the handball that led to a penalty.
6.
James milner: anonymous as england's captain.
Milner is a solid presence but not big on inspirational moments.
5.
Danny drinkwater: solid debut from the leicester city midfielder.
Did himself no harm and can be happy with his debut but did he make a compelling case for inclusion in euro 2016?
Not sure.
6.
Ross barkley: busy first half and a trademark second-half surge that set up a chance for adam lallana.
6.
Adam lallana: decent night for the liverpool midfielder.
Clever pass played its part in england's goal and was warmly applauded when substituted.
7.
Daniel sturridge: once he'd stopped fiddling with his bootlaces he settled down and produced one or two moments that hint at the threat he could yet pose for england.
6.
Jamie vardy: england's star man.
Busy, scored one and could have had another.

Substitutes: walcott (for sturridge, 57 minutes): odd flash of pace and one rising shot over the bar but otherwise quiet.
6.
Clyne (for rose, 57 minutes): not much of an opportunity and consequently not much impact.
5.
Kane (for lallana, 70 minutes): just a couple of half-chances but no rescue act from the man who is now england's first-choice striker.
5.
Jagielka (for smalling, 70 minutes): claimed he was fouled by janssen in the lead-up to the winner but should have been stronger in that situation.
5.
Alli (for milner, 82 minutes): no rating.
Dier (for drinkwater, 84 minutes): no rating.

summary: England was defeated by the Netherlands 2-1 in a friendly match at Wembley Stadium. England started strong, with Jamie Vardy scoring in the 44th minute, but the Netherlands equalized in the second half through a Vincent Janssen penalty. Luciano Narsingh scored the winning goal for the Netherlands in the 82nd minute. The defeat for England came despite a much-changed side from their previous victory against Germany, with several young players getting a chance to start. The result highlights the work in progress for England's defense, particularly with John Stones, who had a shaky performance.

title: REDDIT-41:falcon7b-ul2
source:
This happened a week or two ago.
I was in scotland with the main intention of climbing ben nevis, the highest mountain in the uk.
I woke up pretty early for this, and when i woke up realised my toenails needed cutting first.
But i was too tired, and the process of breakfast made me forget, and me and my dad set off.
There was little problem on the ascent, although i did realise that i'd forgotten about halfway up.
The walk down, however, was different.
After ten minutes of descent, with all of me feeling like shit from the climb, my big toe began to hurt.
Eventually it got to the point where i had to take baby steps to minimise the pain.
By the last half of the mountain every tiny step felt like i was stunning my toe.
Normally it's quicker when you go down a mountain compared to the climb, but my memory cost me hours and a shit ton of pain, by the end my legs were shaking and stiff, as i had to keep myself from moving too far with each step, using far more energy than i would have otherwise.
I felt sick and, after sitting down at the bottom, could barely bring myself to limp to the car park, since then the nail on my big toe has gone black, but the pain is gone.
summary: when climbing ben nevis, even though the climb itself wasn't too difficult, it was difficult to descend due to pain in the feet.

source:
Welsh housing associations directly contributed more than £1bn to the economy in 2014/15, an independent report has said.
The welsh economy research report showed 79% of direct spend was retained in wales, and associations built nearly 2,000 affordable homes.
This was an increase of 4% on the previous year.
The annual report, commissioned by community housing cymru, looked at the impact of social housing in wales.
£1.1bn contributed to the economy in 2014/15 £872m of that was retained in wales 1,923 new homes built in 2014/15 £301m on repairs/maintenance in 2014/15 £532m on regeneration in 2014/15
summary: Welsh housing associations made a substantial contribution to the economy in 2014/15, directly contributing over £1 billion. The majority of this expenditure, approximately 79%, remained within Wales. The associations alsoplayed a significant role in addressing the housing needs of the region, constructing nearly 2,000 affordable homes, representing a 4% increase compared to the previous year. Additionally, they invested in property upkeep and regeneration, spending £301 million on repairs and maintenance and £532 million on regeneration projects. These findings were outlined in an independent report commissioned by Community Housing Cymru, highlighting the positive impact of social housing in Wales.

title: REDDIT-48:llama7b-ul2
source:
This just happened, and i had to compose myself before i could draft up this post.
I work for a distributor that prides itself on our level of customer service.
I received a message from a customer.
They gave us the wrong address to ship an order to.
I saw that the package was still intransit to the wrong address, so i knew that i would be able to have the carrier intercept the package, but i had to act quickly.
So, i contacted the carrier.
I give the carrier the tracking number, and the new correct address.
The carrier says that it will cost $36 to reroute the package.
That is fine, i tell them.
The customer really needs the parts.
Okey doke.
The change is made.
I send a message back to the customer that we were able to reroute the package.
This whole transaction took about a half hour to complete.
I sit back for a moment and revel in my skills.
But.
Then.
Wait.
Hold on.
Did i have to go through all of that?
I check the value of the order.
The total value of the order is only $5.
And the part on the order is a part that we have thousands in stock.
For that low value, i could simply and literally have just shipped the order all over again to the correct location, for free, and just told the customer to forget about the original order.
It would have cost a lot less, and only taken 2 minutes to do.
To add more dismay, when i saw the new adjusted expected delivery date to the new corrected address, the customer would have gotten the parts sooner by a couple days if i had just entered a new order for them, instead of needlessly traversing the gauntlet that i decided to subject myself and my company to in modifying the already intransit order.
summary: A customer gave us the wrong address to ship an order to, and we were able to reroute the package for a fee of $36. However, the value of the order was only $5, and it would have been faster and cheaper to simply ship a new order to the correct address.

title: XSUM-39219188:llama70b-ul2
source:
Amputee football is played all over the world but it is in its infancy in scotland, where organisers are trying to form a new league.
"it gives me a lot of confidence and a lot of good friends," says one of the players on a five-a-side football pitch in the north of glasgow.
He's moving around nimbly on crutches, putting everything into the training and drills.
There are shouts for the ball, plenty of laughter but lots of hard work.
After all some of the players here have their next competitive game in just over a week.
Many of them do play on crutches, others with prosthetic limbs.
The sport of amputee football has been going for many years south of the border and now a charity is now trying to form a scotland-wide league.
It is holding the first amputee football scottish cup in edinburgh next month.
This team i am watching is linked to partick thistle.
"i wish, looking back, i hadn't let it stop me," says brian murray, who lost his leg to cancer at the age of 10.
He says that, although as a youngster he did play on crutches with his pals, when he went to secondary school he lost confidence and began wearing his prosthetic leg all the time.
His introduction to amputee football was in england, regularly travelling to everton to get a game.
It is rough at times - he broke his collarbone last year, but did not let that put him off.
He describes the sport now being in scotland as "brilliant".
"that's what i want to give to youngsters," he says.
"don't let anyone stop you, just go for it."
He adds that if he is still playing at the age of 47, then "it doesn't matter what age you are".
Amputee football is played all over the world.
In turkey, for instance, there is a professional league, aired on television with 600 players.
Scotland is hoping to play some friendlies against other european countries later in the year.
"amputee football is just about getting people out and playing football," says ashley reid of the amputee football association scotland (afas).
"the limb difference, the amputation is not relevant at all when people are here training.
It's just about playing football."
She says she saw a clear demand for the sport in scotland.
The task now is to try to spread out across the country.
In among the men on the pitch is one woman.
In fact, she is the only woman playing in the amputee football league in the uk.
"all amputees are used to being the odd one out in the crowd," rebecca sellar explains.
"so coming into this as the only woman, you get on with it and over it."
She would like to get more women involved.
Rebecca says that since she started she has been welcomed into the game and on a personal level has gained fitness as well as the enjoyment of taking part in a team sport.
She says: "our numbers are growing and the more word we can get out there to encourage people to get involved the better we can have it as a sport for scotland."
summary: A charity in Scotland is trying to form a new league for amputee football, which has been played all over the world for years. The sport has been popular in England, and now organizers are trying to spread it across Scotland, with the first Scottish Cup to be held in Edinburgh next month. One player, Brian Murray, who lost his leg to cancer at age 10, found confidence through the sport and now wants to encourage youngsters to join. The Amputee Football Association Scotland (AFAS) aims to get more people playing and spread the sport across the country. The only woman currently playing in the UK, Rebecca Sellar, would like to see more women join.

title: XSUM-35441162:geminipro-ul2
source:
Claims direct cross-border rail services could be under threat due to devolution have been dismissed by wales' transport minister.
Edwina hart accused uk officials of "ignorance" amid suggestions passengers could have to change trains on some services between wales and england.
Responsibility for the wales and border network will be devolved in 2017.
A department of transport spokesman said no decisions would be made without considering local views.
Services from aberystwyth to birmingham and milford haven to manchester via cardiff, are among routes which could be affected.
In last year's st david's day agreement, the uk government wrote: "in order for the secretary of state for transport to ensure proper accountability, it is likely that services primarily serving english markets will be placed into other franchises for which the secretary of state for transport is the franchising authority".
Responding to suggestions some passengers may have to change trains on cross-border routes, mrs hart said some whitehall officials "don't actually understand how things work and what are important".
"i base some of their comments on ignorance rather than a conspiracy theory," she said.
"we want to ensure those services remain within the franchise."
John rogers from campaign group railfutures wales said: "it's ludicrous, it's impractical, it's being done behind the scenes with a lot of secrecy initially and we're determined to fight it".
"it's not in the interests of passengers.
People hate changing trains, it's a deterrent and it would affect the tourist industry," he added.
A department for transport spokesman said: "we are working closely with the welsh government to develop plans for cross-border routes and stations as we move towards devolving the next wales and border franchise".
summary: Wales' Transport Minister, Edwina Hart, refuted claims that devolution may lead to disruptions in direct cross-border rail services between Wales and England, calling them ignorant. Mrs. Hart believes some Whitehall officials lack understanding of how things work. The responsibility for the Wales and Border network will be devolved in 2017. The UK government stated that services primarily serving English markets would likely be placed into other franchises under the franchising authority of the Secretary of State for Transport. John Rogers from Railfutures Wales expressed opposition to potential changes, emphasizing the inconvenience and negative impact on tourism.

title: REDDIT-50:llama70b-ul2

This actually happened on saturday but whatever i had better things to do than post a tifu.
So i'm at a house party where some of the people also happen to know my younger brother.
I text him that i am at this party with [insert his friend's names here] and that he should come by since i haven't seen him in a while.
Night continues on drinking and such and i end up taking a round of shots with my friends.
My brother texts me as i'm taking the shot to come outside and let him in, so i skip the chaser and run outside.
Turns out he bought a new car and wanted to show it to me real quick so i hop in the passenger seat and check it out.
While sitting there i notice an open can of rock star in his cupholder.
Realizing my mouth still tastes like tequila and being thirsty i decide to take a swig...turns out my brother had recently taken up chewing tobacco and this can of rock star was actually full of his chew spit.
My brother looks and instantly starts laughing as i realize what i have just ingested and i proceed to vomit all over the neighbor's front yard.
summary: A person went to a house party where they met up with friends and had a few drinks. They received a text from their brother asking to meet up, and they went outside to see his new car. While sitting in the passenger seat, they noticed an open can of Rock Star in the cupholder and, thinking it was their brother's drink, took a swig. It turned out that the can was actually filled with their brother's chewing tobacco spit, and the person immediately vomited in the neighbor's front yard.

spans.text: thinking it was their brother's drink

title: XSUM-36015122:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Security forces are controlling who enters the main office of the crisis-hit nigerian football federation in the capital abjua, bbc sport has learned.
Soldiers and riot police are manning the entrance of the building.
It follows last week's court ruling that nff president amaju pinnick lost his post to chris giwa in elections in september 2014.
Giwa and his team had said they would occupy and take over the nff offices to start work on monday.
The nff has appealed against the court ruling, insisting that pinnick is still the head of the federation.
And staff of the fifa-recognised nff, including the general secretary mohammed sanusi, are currently working in the building.
Giwa's faction and all other non-nff staff have been denied access into the football house by police, who have been in attendance since sunday.
"we got here this morning and the police requested our identity cards, then we were let into our offices," an nff staff member told bbc sport.
"only those without any proof of nff identifications are prevented from coming to the building."
The ongoing power struggle means nigeria face the prospect of a fifa ban, which could put their world cup qualification hopes in jeopardy.
summary: The Nigerian Football Federation (NFF) headquarters in Abuja is under control of security forces, following a court ruling that NFF president Amaju Pinnick lost his post to Chris Giwa in September 2014 elections. Giwa and his team had intended to occupy the offices and start work on Monday, but were denied access by police. Staff of the Fifa-recognised NFF, including general secretary Mohammed Sanusi, are currently working in the building, while Giwa's faction and all other non-NFF staff are prevented from entering. The ongoing power struggle between the two factions could jeopardize Nigeria's World Cup qualification hopes.

title: REDDIT-83:geminipro-ul2

Both me and my girlfriend participate in winter sports at our highschool, i swim and she fences.
Today was a late meet for me (8pm meet) and it is a rule we must dress up for a meet.
My girlfriend has a normal practice today, normally school gets out at 3:02 and her practice is at 3:15. she has to get changed so i wait outside the locker rooms for her so i could give her a kiss goodbye.
What i don''t realize is that my bus leaves while i''m standing outside the locker rooms.
Being a slow dresser she is in there till the last minute.
After she comes out i give her a kiss goodbye and walk outside.
There was nothing, nobody, but the steady snow fall.
Naturally i freak out and start making calls, my friend says he got dropped off already so i call my house... no answer.. my parents and older sister are working so no answer from them.. now i''m paying the price with a 6 mile walk hold in freezing temperatures in my thin dress shirt and no gloves or hat.

title: XSUM-38773590:falcon7b-ul2
source:
Burton albion have signed lasse vigen christensen and cauley woodrow on loan from championship rivals fulham until the end of the season.
Attacking midfielder christensen, 22, has played more than 50 games for the london side, but has not started a championship match this season.
Striker woodrow, 22, has only started one league match but scored twice in the efl cup against leyton orient.
Both players are available to face qpr on saturday.
Brewers manager nigel clough said: "lasse has a good season or so under his belt in the championship.
He's been a bit unlucky not to feature much this season, but they see him in their long-term plans and it will help him to play for us.
"cauley is one to add to our striking options.
With luke varney out for four to six weeks and will miller's hamstring injury, it was important to get another striker in."
Find all the latest football transfers on our dedicated page or visit our premier league tracker here.
summary: Burton Albion sign Fulham duo Christensen and Woodrow on loan until the end of the season.

title: REDDIT-23:gpt4-ul2
source:
My eight hours standing at a register were coming to an end, and i couldn't have been more on autopilot.
While i was ringing up this one really old couple (i'd guess they were nearly 80), i started to wonder what i will wish i would have known now when i am older.
I thought i would probably check reddit to see if anyone has ever asked something along the lines of, "older people of reddit, what should younger people really start considering for what will happen for the rest of their lives?"
As i got to this point in my thought process, it was time for me to dismiss the old couple, and instead of saying "enjoy the rest of your day" like i normally do, i accidentally said "enjoy the rest of your lives."
The man seemed appalled while the woman gave me a nasty look and quickly turned away.
I was too confused at myself to say anything, so i just stood there.
It was uncomfortable as hell.
summary: After an eight-hour shift at a cash register, the narrator absentmindedly wishes an elderly couple to "enjoy the rest of your lives," instead of a traditional farewell message like "enjoy the rest of your day." The couple responded negatively to the accidental comment, leaving the narrator feeling uncomfortable and embarrassed. The incident occurred while the narrator was contemplating what older people wish they had known when they were younger.

title: REDDIT-18:geminipro-ul2
source:
This happened when i was about 9 years old and still catching bugs in our front yard to keep in jars.
I hard a gnarly grasshopper collection in a jar and built their own little terrarium.
One day i was outside checking for more grasshoppers when i spot this huge praying mantis on a bush.
I immediately caught it and brought it back to my house to put back in my terrarium.
I went off to play some videogames and came back to check on them about 3 hours later.
That's when i saw 2 pairs of wings on the bottom and the praying mantis chewing on the end of another wing.
Edit: spelling
summary: When the author was 9 years old, they kept a collection of grasshoppers in a terrarium. One day, they found a large praying mantis and added it to the terrarium. After returning from playing video games, they discovered that the praying mantis had eaten one of the grasshoppers and sprouted wings.

title: REDDIT-6:geminipro-ul2
source:
Little background: i work as a part-time clerk at a grocery store, mostly bagging groceries.
This just happened to me 6 hours ago.
In the last hour of my shift today, i was talking to my coworker about various topics that affect us in our daily lives when a grumpy woman comes through my line.
We start talking about how the store was changed around majorly since the last renovation.
She mentions how she knows five people who don't shop at the store anymore because of this and seems a little frustrated.
I decided to tell her in a dazed manner that most large retail stores don't care if they lose five people so long as they keep getting customers to come in and shop, which i now realize was a complete mistake.
Now i'm waiting until friday to figure out what hr wants to do with me, and now i'm suspended until further notice.
Edit: looks like i still have my job.
Still, i'm looking for a better job.
summary: The grocery clerk engaged in a casual conversation with a coworker about life and changes in the store. They mentioned that five people had stopped shopping there because of renovations. The clerk responded by explaining that large stores do not typically worry about losing a small number of customers. This comment upset the customer, who reported the clerk to HR. The clerk is suspended until further notice.

title: REDDIT-37:llama70b-ul2
source:
Context: i've recently come down with a pretty nasty ear infection, that just seems to get worse.
On the first day, my inner ear felt congested, and flared up in pain when i bit down on anything.
Obviously, i decide to head to a clinic, and was promptly diagnosed with an inner ear infection.
On the second day, i felt lightheaded and dizzy, but decided to push on through.
However, by the third day, i was starting to feel queasy, and heavily feverish.
I checked my temp with an oral thermometer, and, just as i suspected, i was running a low fever.
Now, here's where the tifu starts.
A couple weeks back, i made plans with a friend to go see justice league.
We were both pretty hyped up, because we're pretty big fans of the characters.
Even though i was feeling pretty shitty, i decided to go through with our  plans, and go anyways.
I had started to feel a little better by the time noon rolled around, so i thought i could keep it together until i got back home.
Boy, was i wrong.
When we got to the theater, my fever had slowly started to return, along with a stomach ache.
It started out pretty mild, but slowly progressed.
By the midway point, i was barely keeping it together.
Around the setup to the climax, i could feel my throat burning, and my stomach rumbling like a geyser, preparing to erupt.
And erupt it did... as i was starting to get ready to make a break for the bathroom, the inevitable time bomb that was my gut finally exploded.
Thanks to the advice i'd gotten about staying hydrated, the nearly-endless stream of vomit that shot out of my mouth was extra liquidy, leading to an ever growing puddle of puke, swelling up around my shoes.
Quickly, the soupy stream of spew made it's way down the isle, alerting everyone that hadn't already noticed the atrocity i had just committed before them.
Soon came an endless torrent of remarks, such as "geez, why's it all wet here?
", "who just spilled their drink?"
"why is my shoe so moist?"
And many more.
Eventually, the ushers had become aware of the mess i had  just jettisoned from my throat, and started evacuating the theater.
I couldn't make eye contact with my friend, as i rushed back to my car to speed home.
summary: A person recently went to see the movie Justice League while feeling ill with an ear infection and a low fever. Despite feeling unwell, they decided to go through with their plans, but ended up vomiting in the theater during the movie, causing a scene and leading to the evacuation of the theater. The person was embarrassed and couldn't make eye contact with their friend.

summary: Kyle visited his doctor due to a persistent cough that had lasted for three months. A chest X-ray revealed a lung nodule, confirmed by a CT scan. He has a history of rheumatoid arthritis, controlled with methotrexate, and quit smoking seven years ago. His physical exam was normal, and his chest CT showed a solitary two-centimeter nodule in the right upper lobe, appearing smooth with no emphysematous disease. The doctorordered pulmonary function tests and a PET CT to assess the nodule's metabolic activity. He recommended surgical removal of the nodule via video-assisted thoracoscopy, with a one-night hospital stay. The doctor advised Kyle to continue follow-up with his rheumatologist for his rheumatoid arthritis.

spans.text: a persistent cough that had lasted for three months

title: REDDIT-9:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Semi obligatory to say that this did not happen today, but this was basically the earliest i could make this.
So i'm in my first year of college and was getting into the typical college stuff; partying, sports, alcohol, and of course academics.
About 3 weeks ago i was working on a math assignment online, which provides instant feedback on whether you got the question correct.
Typically its pretty easy and i'm done within about 30 minutes, but this one was incredibly difficult.
Already about 90 minutes in and not even halfway done, i had spent about the last 10 on one problem.
Confident in the answer i got, i submitted and saw that i was wrong.
Frustrated, i quickly (and according to my roommates, not even that hard) hit my laptop and went to see where i could have gone in the process.
I then wanted to change tabs, but for some reason my computer was not responding, which to me wasn't a big deal since it had happened a few times earlier, so i did what i normally did and did a hard power off.
Turning on the power again, my heart immediately dropped.
Black screen.
Computer beeping.
Message with something similar to 'error in bootup.'
I immediately check my phone on the error and see that it likely has something to do with hard drive, and it was confirmed on one of the info in the settings said that no hard drive was found.
Luckily my roommates were super nice and let me use one of their laptops to complete the assignment.
The next day i took it to the campus tech services for help.
And it took them about half a week for them to tell me that they wouldn't be able to help with the issue i originally told them about.
(looking back it was probably dumb to take it to them, since they aren't the biggest tech experts, but i'm a student and i'm not made of money.)
The next week was pretty bad, i spent it in the library or on the roommates laptops doing homework and searching on my phone for places to go to get it repaired.
And with my schedule conflicting with their open times (the only places that were open on weekends were way too expensive for my budget) and the fact that i didn't take a car to college and had to bum rides from one of my roommates, i was out of luck for that entire week.
Finally, late last week i finally got time to go to a repair place and finally get it done.
Upon immediate review the hard drive was busted and basically unsalvagable and i had to get a new one.
Luckily the people were kind and gave me a fair estimate of about $200 (which was like 1/2 other places were estimating) and also tacked on a student discount.
Still shipping for a new hard drive and repairs took a week, so that was another week in the library and borrowing laptops again.
Finally today i got news of it being repaired.
Spent most of the day reinstalling things and finally can get back to my usual daily life of web browsing reddit and steam games.
Math homework has also been a lot easier so the same thing repeating should hopefully be avoided for a long time now.
summary: The document describes the experience of a college student who encountered a problem with their laptop while working on an online math assignment. The student had already spent 90 minutes on the assignment and was confident in their answer, but when they submitted it, they received a message that they were wrong. Frustrated, the student hit their laptop and tried to change tabs, but their computer was not responding. They then turned off the power and turned it back on, but the screen was black and the computer was beeping with an error message. The student checked their phone and saw that it was likely related to the hard drive, and they were able to use their roommates' laptops to complete the assignment.

title: XSUM-32915014:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Gopro's chief executive has confirmed it will make its own quadcopter drones.
Nick woodman described the remote controlled aircraft as the "ultimate" accessory for his firm's action cameras.
He made the announcement at the code conference in california, where he also unveiled new kit to that helps capture video footage for virtual reality helmets.
One industry watcher said gopro's move into drones was "very significant".
"it's the fact that the company has such a strong brand," explained john stapley from amateur photographer magazine.
"it's similar to what you can already see with action cameras.
There are a lot of others out there but most people don't know they exist or don't have any interest in them because gopro has become such a dominant name that it is 'the action brand' as far as they are concerned."
The risk for the firm, he added, was that other drone manufacturers would opt to partner with other camera makers to avoid supporting a competitor.
The world's bestselling commercial drone maker - china's dji - has already decided to limit initial sales of its phantom 3 flagship to a design that features its own proprietary video camera.
The previous generation had been launched instead with an optional mount for gopro cams.
Mr woodman said he planned to release the gopro drone within the first half of 2016, and that it would be targeted at consumers.
"quadcopters have a special place for us at gopro because i was a huge radio-controlled plane enthusiast as a kid and i could never really get anyone involved in it with me because it was either too geeky or it took a lot of time to learn how to fly these things - you'd crash them all the time," he said.
"so, i was really surprised to see how quickly the general consumer was adopting quadcopters.
"quads plus gopro has been one of the most democratising combinations in terms of enabling people to capture professional quality content and see themselves in their environment in a way that they'd never seen before.
It looks like you're in your own movie."
Drones are expected to be one of the fastest growing electronics sectors over the coming years.
According to the us's consumer electronics association, the global market for consumer drones totalled $84m (â£54m) last year but is forecast to top $300m by 2018.
The cea adds that if regulators relax the rules for the use of such aircraft by commercial organisations, the market could further swell to $1bn by 2020.
That could represent a lucrative new market for gopro.
The firm's existing cameras and other accessories generated $363m of sales over the first three months of 2015.
That was up 54% on the previous year, but resulted in a relatively slim net profit of $16.8m.
Mr woodman also showed off a prototype mount that can hold six of his firm's hero4 cameras, each pointing in a different direction.
He said the resulting footage could be stitched together using software developed by kolor - a start-up it bought last month - to create a single 6k-quality 360-degree image.
This could then be used with virtual reality helmets - allowing a user to change their perspective by turning their head left and right and looking up and down - or via youtube and facebook, which are both adding support for interactive spherical videos.
The six-camera spherical array add-on will go on sale later this year.
Mr woodman acknowledged, however, that the high cost of buying enough cameras to fill it was likely to limit the mount's appeal to professionals.
At a subsequent event, google also announced a more elaborate virtual reality capture device, which involves 16 gopro cameras, as part of a tie-up between the two companies.
The footage produced by the jump camera array will be processed by the search firm's own software to produce panoramas, rather than spherical videos, that make use of depth data deduced by google's algorithms.
summary: GoPro's CEO, Nick Woodman, has announced that the company will develop its own quadcopter drones. He stated that drones are the "ultimate" accessory for the firm's action cameras. Woodman also introduced new equipment designed to capture video footage for virtual reality helmets. The move is seen as significant as GoPro has become a dominant name in the action camera market. The drone will be targeted at consumers and is expected to be released within the first half of 2016. The global market for consumer drones is expected to reach $1 billion by 2020 if regulators relax the rules for commercial use.

title: XSUM-40110402:gpt4-ul2
source:
Companies must prepare for new tougher eu rules on data protection, or face big fines, pwc has warned.
The financial services firm said new rules, coming into effect next may, could see fines soar to 20m euros (£17.4m) or more.
Fines for data breaches had already risen, from 18 in 2015, to 35 in 2016, amounting to £3.2m in total, said pwc.
There were also 23 enforcement notices, where organisations were required to improve compliance - a 155% increase.
According to pwc's research, the uk is one of the most active places in europe for regulatory enforcement in this area, along with italy.
Penalties issued by the uk information commissioner's office in 2016 included a record £400,000 fine for telecoms firm talktalk over security failings that allowed a cyber attacker to access customer data "with ease".
In 2015 the online pharmacy pharmacy 2u was also told to pay £130,000 after it sold details of more than 20,000 customers to marketing companies without their consent.
However, pwc said that when the new general data protection regulation (gdpr) becomes law across the eu next may, firms would face much tougher obligations and penalties.
In particular, the information commissioner's office will be able to issue fines of up to 4% of global turnover, or 20m euros - whichever is highest.
The regulator can only issues fines of up to £500,000 at present.
"uk organisations must use the remaining time to prepare for gdpr compliance before may next year," said stewart room, an expert in global cybersecurity and data protection at pwc.
The uk is due to adopt the new rules before it leaves the eu, but pwc said it was unlikely to water down the protections after it left the union.
summary: Companies are being warned by PwC to prepare for tougher data protection rules enforced by the EU. This warning comes as the threat of increased fines – of up to £17.4m ($22.5m), a huge leap from the current maximum of £500,000 – looms. The UK and Italy are seen as the most active countries in Europe for regulatory enforcement, threatening increased penalties issued by the UK Information Commissioner's Office. The number of data breach fines has already risen, with 35 in 2016 compared to 18 in 2015.

spans.text: issued by the UK Information Commissioner's Office

title: REDDIT-72:gpt4-ul2
source:
Tifu, but actually this happened a few weeks ago.
I moved back home after college last year and this past 2014 i signed up for my first ever reddit secret santa.
I'm typically the one that gets the mail, but occasionally my mom gets it too so i told her that i signed up for a secret santa and something should be coming in the mail for me from a stranger and i have no idea what will be inside so to make sure not to open it.
I also told her that it likely wouldn't be coming under my name, but under my username instead.
She said ok and that was that.
A few days later we're having dinner and my dad says "the mail man knocked on the door with a package today and i thought it was weird because it was addressed for someone named sandwich.
I told him that no sandwiches live here and gave it back to him to return".
I face palmed and exclaimed "that was for me!"
Of course my dad then followed up with "ummm.. how are you a sandwich?"
I explained that i signed up for secret santa and that that was my username, to which he said "well why didn't you warn us?"
My dad typically does not get the mail so i didn't even think of telling him, but oh well it was done and now i had to somehow try to retrieve this mysterious package.
It was night time now and the package did not have a tracking number, so i would have to begin my hunt the next day.
Fast forward to the morning, i got to the post office the minute they opened and told the post office woman, "hi!
So i have a strange request..." and she looked at me with this face of concern and said "alright..." so i told her "i don't know if you're familiar, but i signed up for reddit secret santa.
And i got a package yesterday, but my dad sent it back because it was addressed to a sandwich.
So assuming you haven't sent it back yet, there should be a package waiting here for a sandwich, but its anonymous which means i have no idea where it's from or what the package looks like, all i know is it's for a sandwich."
She looks at me like i'm crazy, but says ok and heads to the back.
She comes back and says i found it!
She handed it to me saying "sandwich huh" and i went on my way home with my sandwich addressed package.
Overall my reddit secret santa experience was more memorable than i anticipated.
summary: The document tells a story about the author's experience with their first Reddit Secret Santa, an online gift exchange. After informing their mother about an incoming package addressed to their username (not their real name), they didn't think to tell their father, who rarely gets the mail. However, when such a package arrived and their father couldn't recognize the name (which was 'sandwich'), it was mistakenly returned to the mailman. The author had to rush to retrieve the package the following morning, explaining the situation to the confused post office lady who finally handed over the package addressed to 'sandwich'. The whole experience made the Reddit Secret Santa more memorable than the author had imagined.

title: REDDIT-79:llama7b-ul2
source:
This technically happened today, but started late last night.
So i was very determined to finish writing my annotated bibliography for ap language before it was due.
I finished it at just after midnight after working on it for a few hours.
As i was getting ready for bed, i saw my phone on my bedside table and forgot it was even there.
I had some missed texts and emails, but nothing too important.
I checked the battery life, and it was fully charged.
I thought to myself that i'd leave it on the other side of the room so when the alarm goes off, i have to get up and turn it off.
My alarm goes off at 6:30 in the morning.
This is a very vulnerable time for me, especially after hours of writing.
So right on cue, the alarm goes off, i get up, and i go to turn it off.
The problem with that was i couldn't find my phone.
I was frantically searching for it in my groggy state, moving papers around, moving folders around, nothing.
I ran into my mom's room and told her to call my phone because i couldn't find it.
She hears my alarm and looks at me like i'm stupid.
I go back in my room and shut off the alarm that was right on the edge of my desk and i go back to sleep.
Then i woke up late and ran out to get to school.
summary: A student worked on an annotated bibliography late at night, finishing it at midnight. They forgot their phone on their bedside table and missed several texts and emails. When their alarm went off, they couldn't find their phone and had to have their mom call it. They turned off the alarm and went back to sleep, but woke up late and rushed to get to school.

spans.text: had to have their mom call it

title: XSUM-39219188:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Amputee football is played all over the world but it is in its infancy in scotland, where organisers are trying to form a new league.
"it gives me a lot of confidence and a lot of good friends," says one of the players on a five-a-side football pitch in the north of glasgow.
He's moving around nimbly on crutches, putting everything into the training and drills.
There are shouts for the ball, plenty of laughter but lots of hard work.
After all some of the players here have their next competitive game in just over a week.
Many of them do play on crutches, others with prosthetic limbs.
The sport of amputee football has been going for many years south of the border and now a charity is now trying to form a scotland-wide league.
It is holding the first amputee football scottish cup in edinburgh next month.
This team i am watching is linked to partick thistle.
"i wish, looking back, i hadn't let it stop me," says brian murray, who lost his leg to cancer at the age of 10.
He says that, although as a youngster he did play on crutches with his pals, when he went to secondary school he lost confidence and began wearing his prosthetic leg all the time.
His introduction to amputee football was in england, regularly travelling to everton to get a game.
It is rough at times - he broke his collarbone last year, but did not let that put him off.
He describes the sport now being in scotland as "brilliant".
"that's what i want to give to youngsters," he says.
"don't let anyone stop you, just go for it."
He adds that if he is still playing at the age of 47, then "it doesn't matter what age you are".
Amputee football is played all over the world.
In turkey, for instance, there is a professional league, aired on television with 600 players.
Scotland is hoping to play some friendlies against other european countries later in the year.
"amputee football is just about getting people out and playing football," says ashley reid of the amputee football association scotland (afas).
"the limb difference, the amputation is not relevant at all when people are here training.
It's just about playing football."
She says she saw a clear demand for the sport in scotland.
The task now is to try to spread out across the country.
In among the men on the pitch is one woman.
In fact, she is the only woman playing in the amputee football league in the uk.
"all amputees are used to being the odd one out in the crowd," rebecca sellar explains.
"so coming into this as the only woman, you get on with it and over it."
She would like to get more women involved.
Rebecca says that since she started she has been welcomed into the game and on a personal level has gained fitness as well as the enjoyment of taking part in a team sport.
She says: "our numbers are growing and the more word we can get out there to encourage people to get involved the better we can have it as a sport for scotland."
summary: Amputee football is a sport played all over the world and is in its infancy in Scotland. Organizers are trying to form a new league, and a charity is holding the first amputee football Scottish Cup next month. Many of the players play on crutches or prosthetic limbs, and the sport has been going for many years in England. Amputee football is about getting people out and playing football, regardless of their limb difference or amputation. The Amputee Football Association Scotland (AFAS) is trying to spread the sport across the country and encourage more women to get involved.

spans.text: encourage more women to get involved
is trying to spread the sport across the country

title: XSUM-38905952:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Super league newcomers leigh centurions have signed hull fc utility back curtis naughton on a season-long loan deal.
The 21-year-old will help cover the loss of james clare, who has a serious knee injury, and the release of lee smith from his contract.
Naughton came through the academy at bradford, and spent a year at sydney roosters before joining hull in 2015.
"bringing in curtis gives him an opportunity to catapult his career at the top level," said coach neil jukes.
summary: Leigh Centurions, newcomers to the Super League, have signed Hull FC utility back Curtis Naughton on a season-long loan deal. The 21-year-old will help cover the loss of James Clare, who has a serious knee injury, and the release of Lee Smith from his contract. Naughton came through the academy at Bradford and spent a year at Sydney Roosters before joining Hull in 2015. Coach Neil Jukes stated that bringing in Naughton will give him an opportunity to catapult his career at the top level.

title: REDDIT-14:gpt4-ul2
source:
I have a classmate who is really interested in guns, knives, explosives etc., we'll call him a. many weeks back, i took back some magnesium powder from the school lab for campfire effects.
A saw me placing it inside my locker, and offered to trade a spoonful of magnesium for a handmade firecracker explosive.
I agreed, as it sounded pretty awesome.
It looked like a cherry bomb but it was really small.
He told me that all i had to do was to light up the fuse and wait for it to explode.
Today i attempted to detonate it in class.
That was the first mistake because its an enclosed classroom.
Everyone else was at other lessons so it was empty.
Moving the tables to the side, i created a space where it could "safely detonate".
Lighting it, i ran to the back of class and took cover.
The fuse was a sparkler and it burnt all the way till the flash powder, but nothing happened.
I took out the fuse and realized that the portion of it inside the flash powder had already disintegrated.
This is the stupid part.
I didn't know what i was thinking.
Maybe i thought it was a dud or something.
I took my lighter and lit the rest of it.
My left hand (thumb, index and middle finger) was holding it when it exploded.
It was really loud and made me go partially deaf for the next 5 minutes.
My fingertips are heavily bruised and there is a bit of internal bleeding under my middle fingernail.
Right now i'm suffering from tinnitus in my left ear as i type with only my right hand.
My left hand is in a sock with ointment on it.
My only fear of this is that my hearing may be damaged and this could result in me not being able to go for a private pilot license course i plan to take up at the end of the year.
If anyone has shot guns without earplugs before, you may know what i'm going through now.
Do advise.
I didn't dare to tell my parents the truth, so i told them i smashed my fingers in the doorway.
For the hearing issue, i'm not sure how i'm gonna explain that.
P.s i think this is karma, because i drew a huge realistic penis on my friend's physics workbook yesterday.
Doesn't help that the 3 fingers injured form fleming's left hand rule.
Update: fingers and hearing pretty much back to normal, now i've paid the price of stupidity.
Now i think through everything many times before making a decision to avoid future fus.
Have a nice day.
summary: A student suffered injuries to his hand and temporary hearing loss after a handmade firecracker exploded in his hand. He had traded some magnesium powder for the firecracker with a fellow student who is interested in guns and explosives. He initially attempted to detonate it in an empty classroom, but the fuse disintegrated before anything happened. Working under the assumption it was a dud, the student used his lighter to reignite it, causing an explosion that resulted in heavy bruising to his fingers, temporary deafness and tinnitus. The student, planning to take a private pilot license course, fears he may now have permanent hearing damage. After the incident, he resolved to think things through more carefully before making decisions in the future.

title: REDDIT-12:falcon7b-ul2
source:
This was about a week or two ago but i still think i should share this with you guys.
I was at football practice.
It was the first day of spring practice and i was practicing for qb (quarterbacks throw the ball for people who don't keep up with sports).
I practiced the whole day, got dehydrated and ended up almost passing out.
I asked a coach to go get water but he told me to continue to do the rest of the sprints.
Anyways, it became the end of the day.
It was time for me to practice with the whole offense.
I got in the huddle, called "flex right 2" and the just said "break?
".
For people who don't know, that's not how you do a huddle, this is how you do a huddle: 1) make sure your center is looking at you; make sure your huddle is worth something 2) make sure all eyes are on you 3) say the play twice on both sides of the huddle 4) say "ready, break" i figured it out and i got in position.
I said, "ready go" and the center snapped me the ball.
Now listen, i have no idea what i just called in the huddle.
I just copied exactly what coach told me to say but i didn't know what "flex right 2" was.
So, i got the snap, i looked to my right, and threw the ball to the right outside wide receiver.
I was so proud of myself.
"i threw an accurate pass to the wr and coach will be proud!!"
I thought.
Then the offensive line gets up and says, "didn't he say two?"
I thought, "yeah i said two?"
So i get back in the huddle, and i asked coach, "did i do something wrong?"
"hell yeah!"
He yelled, "you threw on a run play!"
Instantly, i thought i was going to get kicked off the team.
The only thing i could do was say, "i'm so sorry," about 30 times.
I ended up getting yelled at, told if i do that again, i was being moved to another position, and i got laughed at and made fun of for the rest of the week and still even today by other players and friends.
So i quit.
I talked to my coach about it and since he knows i want to play guitar and film more, he offered a shot to go back during the fall and actually film the games!
Then he said if i want to make a career out of it, he could call his good friend from south carolina to possibly get me scholarship money to go down there and film the games.
summary: In this case, the document was about a week or two ago but the speaker still thinks it's important to share. The speaker had a hard time with learning the huddle, was yelled at, and felt embarrassed by it.

So , if you wan na get some of that , you can definitely try that for him , it can help out a little bit with the regular cough .
summary: A one-year-old boy, Randy Gutierrez, was brought to the doctor's office by his parent for a check-up. The child had been experiencing symptoms such as a runny nose, cough, fever, and irritability. The doctor conducted a physical examination, including checking the child's temperature, heart rate, and breathing. The child was diagnosed with a viral infection, and the doctor advised the parent to monitor the child's symptoms and provide plenty of rest and fluids. The doctor also prescribed a medication for the child in case his cough became barky.

title: XSUM-39664212:llama7b-ul2
source:
Police in germany have charged a man suspected of being behind an attack on the borussia dortmund team bus.
Rather than having links to radical islamism, he was a market trader hoping to make money if the price of shares in the team fell, prosecutors say.
The suspect has been charged with attempted murder, triggering explosions and causing serious physical injury.
He has been  identified only as sergej w, and was staying in the team's hotel overlooking the scene of the attack.
Two people needed medical help after three bombs exploded near the bus.
Spanish footballer marc bartra underwent wrist surgery and a police officer was treated for shock.
Following the attack on 11 april, borussia dortmund's home champions league match against monaco was rescheduled a day later, which led dortmund fans to open their doors to stranded away supporters.
Police initially treated the blast as a terrorist attack.
However, the following week, investigators cast "significant doubt" on jihadist motivations being behind it.
They now say the attack was in fact motivated by financial greed.
Sergej w, 28, would have made about €3.9m euros ($4.2m; £3.2m) from his actions, germany's bild newspaper reported.
In a statement on friday (in german), the german federal prosecutor's office said he has german and russian nationality.
He was arrested on friday near tubingen in rottenburg, south-west germany.
The suspect had allegedly bought 15,000 put options on borussia dortmund shares - reportedly priced at €78,000 (£65,000; $83,600) - betting that they would drop sharply after the attack.
He would have made large profits if the team's share price collapsed.
Experts have likened the alleged plot to a sophisticated form of insider trading - because he tried to use information not widely available to the public to make money quickly.
He was staying at the team's l'arrivée hotel in dortmund on the day of the attack and had moved to a room on the top floor, overlooking the street where it took place, prosecutors say.
The suspect placed the bet on 11 april using an ip address traced to the hotel, after taking out a loan for the money.
Investigators believe three explosive devices packed with metal pins were hidden in a hedge and set off as the bus passed.
The bus was damaged about six miles from the westfalenstadion - officially called signal iduna park - in dortmund about 90 minutes before kick-off.
Pictures from the scene showed its windows broken and its tyres burst.
summary: A man suspected of carrying out the bomb attack on the Borussia Dortmund team bus has been charged with attempted murder and other crimes. Prosecutors say the suspect, identified as Sergej W, was motivated by financial greed rather than any link to radical Islamism. He allegedly placed a bet on the team's share price to drop sharply after the attack and stood to make a profit of €3.9m. Investigators say he bought 15,000 put options on the team's shares and placed the bet using an IP address traced to the hotel where he was staying.

title: REDDIT-41:llama70b-ul2
source:
This happened a week or two ago.
I was in scotland with the main intention of climbing ben nevis, the highest mountain in the uk.
I woke up pretty early for this, and when i woke up realised my toenails needed cutting first.
But i was too tired, and the process of breakfast made me forget, and me and my dad set off.
There was little problem on the ascent, although i did realise that i'd forgotten about halfway up.
The walk down, however, was different.
After ten minutes of descent, with all of me feeling like shit from the climb, my big toe began to hurt.
Eventually it got to the point where i had to take baby steps to minimise the pain.
By the last half of the mountain every tiny step felt like i was stunning my toe.
Normally it's quicker when you go down a mountain compared to the climb, but my memory cost me hours and a shit ton of pain, by the end my legs were shaking and stiff, as i had to keep myself from moving too far with each step, using far more energy than i would have otherwise.
I felt sick and, after sitting down at the bottom, could barely bring myself to limp to the car park, since then the nail on my big toe has gone black, but the pain is gone.
summary: The author went on a trip to Scotland with the intention of climbing Ben Nevis, the highest mountain in the UK. They woke up early but forgot to cut their toenails before setting off with their dad. During the descent, the author experienced severe pain in their big toe due to the forgotten toenail clipping, causing them to take baby steps and feel sick. The pain lasted until they reached the bottom of the mountain, and the nail on their big toe turned black.

title: XSUM-35862185:llama7b-ul2
source:
England failed to build on the optimism generated by their thrilling victory in germany as they were beaten in a friendly by the netherlands, who have not even qualified for euro 2016.
On a night when wembley paid its respects to the late dutch legend johan cruyff with applause in the 14th minute, a much-changed england side slipped to a rare defeat at the national stadium.
Man-of-the-match jamie vardy rounded off a slick passing move to steer in kyle walker's cross four minutes before the interval - but roy hodgson's side could not protect their lead.
England's defence lived on the edge too often and were eventually punished when a sloppy passage of play led to danny rose handling, and vincent janssen scored from the spot after 50 minutes.
The big striker was then too strong for substitute phil jagielka, although england complained bitterly he had been fouled, before crossing for luciano narsingh to score the winner 13 minutes from  time.
Vardy's transition from the heights he has scaled with leicester city this season to england has been seamless - and he has stepped up a level in the two friendlies against germany and the netherlands.
The 29-year-old has been portrayed as both an ideal starter and the perfect impact substitute as hodgson makes plans for euro 2016.
Vardy has proved his capabilities for both, with an explosive 20-minute cameo in berlin that included a brilliantly instinctive finish as part of england's comeback.
And here, he was england's outstanding performer by some distance, showing the pace and energy that has panicked premier league defences and also skill to round off that passing move with a clinical finish before testing dutch keeper jeroen zoet with a powerful rising drive.
The debate about how best to use vardy may go on but one thing is beyond dispute - he is going to euro 2016 and has the ability to threaten every defence in france.
In an ideal world, everton's john stones would have come in at wembley to produce the sort of elegant display that became his trademark in the early seasons of his career, thus cementing his place alongside chris smalling for england's first euro 2016 game against russia in marseille.
Instead, wembley witnessed a 21-year-old whose confidence has been hit by a recent dip in form at club level and will need a little renovating before the serious action gets under way.
Stones twice brought murmurs of concern from england's fans inside wembley with his tendency to perhaps over-play out of defence, but his determination to be constructive also started the passing move that led to vardy's goal.
The young defender is a work in progress and there will be slips - quite literally when he stumbled at the start of a chain of events that led to england keeper fraser forster having to save well from janssen before rose handled to leave the striker to score from the spot.
Stones is well worth persevering with - but hodgson must hope some of that confidence and composure returns quickly.
Hodgson warned they must not get carried away after victory in germany - and, in case anyone ignored the warning, along comes a defeat against a dutch team that will not even be in france this summer.
In some respects this defeat, albeit with a much-changed side, simply reinforced some of the lessons that came out of the win in germany that was the catalyst for such a surge of optimism.
England have some very exciting options up front in the shape of vardy and harry kane, while daniel sturridge also got a decent 57 minutes under his belt.
Questions remain, however, about a frail-looking defence with both full-back spots still up for grabs and no central-defensive pairing jumping out as hodgson's first choice at this stage.
England certainly carry a threat but fears persist about their ability to resist attacks of the highest calibre.
Fraser forster: solid night for the southampton keeper despite a couple of fumbles.
Saved well from georginio wijnaldum and vincent janssen.
Clear deputy to joe hart.
7.
Kyle walker: solid and quick in defence and a threat in attack with a perfect pass for vardy to score england's goal.
7.
Chris smalling: part of an uncertain central-defensive partnership that once again hinted at england's frailty against attacks possessing real quality.
6.
John stones: not a great night for everton's 21-year-old.
Yes, his determination to play started the move for england's goal but too often caused anxiety with his tendency to overdo things and second-half slip started chain of events that led to the dutch equaliser.
5.
Danny rose: not an easy night for england's defence but rose kept going and may consider himself unlucky to be punished for the handball that led to a penalty.
6.
James milner: anonymous as england's captain.
Milner is a solid presence but not big on inspirational moments.
5.
Danny drinkwater: solid debut from the leicester city midfielder.
Did himself no harm and can be happy with his debut but did he make a compelling case for inclusion in euro 2016?
Not sure.
6.
Ross barkley: busy first half and a trademark second-half surge that set up a chance for adam lallana.
6.
Adam lallana: decent night for the liverpool midfielder.
Clever pass played its part in england's goal and was warmly applauded when substituted.
7.
Daniel sturridge: once he'd stopped fiddling with his bootlaces he settled down and produced one or two moments that hint at the threat he could yet pose for england.
6.
Jamie vardy: england's star man.
Busy, scored one and could have had another.
8.
Substitutes: walcott (for sturridge, 57 minutes): odd flash of pace and one rising shot over the bar but otherwise quiet.
6.
Clyne (for rose, 57 minutes): not much of an opportunity and consequently not much impact.
5.
Kane (for lallana, 70 minutes): just a couple of half-chances but no rescue act from the man who is now england's first-choice striker.
5.
Jagielka (for smalling, 70 minutes): claimed he was fouled by janssen in the lead-up to the winner but should have been stronger in that situation.
5.
Alli (for milner, 82 minutes): no rating.
Dier (for drinkwater, 84 minutes): no rating.
The three lions wait until 21 may to host turkey, while netherlands meet republic of ireland six days later.

Second half ends, england 1, netherlands 2.

summary: England were beaten by the Netherlands in a friendly at Wembley, despite taking the lead through a Jamie Vardy goal. The visitors equalised through a penalty converted by Vincent Janssen, before Luciano Narsingh scored the winner 13 minutes from time. The result means England have not won any of their last six matches against the Netherlands (D3 L3).

title: ACIBENCH-D2N104:mistral7b-ul2
source:
[doctor] judy gomez , mrn 869723 .
Date of birth , 5 , 7 , 1961 .
She's in office today for ongoing management of psoriatic arthritis .
Hello , judy , how are you doing today ?
[patient] i'm doing good , thank you .
How are you ?
[doctor] i'm great , thanks .
So how have you been since the last time ?
I know the last time we were talking about decreasing your prednisone dose , correct ?
[patient] yes .
I'm just on one now and that seems to be enough .
[doctor] aw , that's great to hear .
[patient] yeah , there were a couple days there i took an extra one , just because there was a little extra pain in my feet .

summary: Dr. Judy Gomez is seeing patient MRN 869723, Judy Gomez, for ongoing management of psoriatic arthritis. The patient is doing well and reports that taking one prednisone dose is sufficient for her current pain level. She also discusses taking an extra dose on occasion when her feet hurt due to her desk job. Dr. Gomez confirms that they are still on track to discontinue the prednisone and will do so today. The patient reports that methotrexate helped with joint pain and that they stopped taking it temporarily due to concerns about it interfering with the COVID-19 vaccine.

title: XSUM-37820092:llama7b-ul2
source:
Shanghai is trialling a unisex public toilet block to lower the time women have to spend waiting in queues, chinese media have reported.
The toilet, in a busy park in pudong new area, will have 10 unisex stalls, plus some urinals and a stall for disabled people.
The opening on 19 november will coincide with world toilet day.
Unisex facilities will spare officials having to decide how to share out male and female stalls, say reports.
"it is an apparent problem that women have to wait in lines for toilets," fu liping, an official involved in the project, was quoted as saying, by the xinhua news agency.
The stalls will be more spacious than regular ones.
To guarantee safety and privacy, there will be attendants and higher partitions between stalls.
But there are no plans yet to build more unisex toilets, as authorities are unsure whether citizens will embrace the idea.
Their caution seem to be well-grounded, as people online have been less than enthusiastic about the unisex lavatory.
"i don't really support the idea.
After all, men and female are different," said weibo user zhu zhu xia.
Another weibo user said: "the problem will be solved if they build double female toilets."
summary: Shanghai is testing a unisex public toilet block to reduce waiting time for women, with 10 unisex stalls, urinals, and a stall for disabled people. However, there are no plans to build more unisex toilets as authorities are unsure of public response. Some citizens have expressed reservations about the idea, with concerns about safety and privacy.

title: REDDIT-76:llama7b-ul2
source:
It's my wife's birthday in 2 weeks so i decided to buy her something really nice.
Yesterday while she was out on an errand i snuck out and bought a very expensive cartier item, making it back home before she got back.
This morning she wakes me up and shows me her phone with a worried look on her face.
On it there's a message from her bank warning her that a very large purchase was made on her credit card.
I jump out of bed, yelling "what the fuck!"
And grab my wallet, finding inside my wife's, identical to my own, credit card rather than my card.
The night before we went to dinner and must have switched our cards after paying.
Kinda shocked that cartier didn't bother to check the name on the card as we have completely different names.
summary: A man bought his wife an expensive Cartier item for her birthday, but when she received a message from her bank about a large purchase on her credit card, he realized they had accidentally switched cards during dinner the night before.

title: REDDIT-34:falcon7b-ul2
source:
I work in a secure mental health hospital in the uk.
I typically work night shifts and last night i was getting peckish.
I thought to myself i'll pop some toast in and quickly go do my observations, by the time i'm back it will be ready.
As i'm doing my checks a couple of patients asked me to do some little things for them and i assist them, completely forgetting about my toast.
Next thing i know, the fire alarms are ringing.
See the interesting thing about secure door locks is that they become unlocked in the event of a fire, to allow people to get out the building, and well, the interesting thing about secure hospitals is that they are supposed to be locked... for the briefest of moments i was confused, then suddenly it dawned on me.
Toast.
I ran to the staff room (which, previously only accessible by staff,  was now open to all as the internal locks are released too) and found smoke billowing from the toaster and a patient sat next to it laughing and munching his way through the black charcoal blocks that remained of my snack.
Luckily, we managed to secure the building, reset the alarm and escort the patient back to his room with no harm done.
One patient however did manage to get out the building however and had to be picked up by police later in the night.
Lesson to self, no more toast on night shift.
Safe to say my manager was not impressed.
summary: On a secure mental health hospital night shift, an employee forgot about their toast, leading to an unexpected fire alarm and evacuation. Although no harm was done, it served as a lesson to the employee to not be distracted by personal matters while on the job.

spans.text: to not be distracted by personal matters

title: XSUM-31763768:llama70b-ul2
source:
Bestival has revealed an all-female line-up in its second wave of announcements for this year's isle of wight event.
Charli xcx, ella eyre and lianne la havas will appear alongside the chemical brothers and underworld.
Other festivals have been criticised for the lack of women on their bills.
Last week, music blog crack in the road posted images of edited posters removing all the names of male performers.
The rather blank-looking page was shared on social media, with the bills at reading and leeds, download and t in the park also a focus for criticism.
Neneh cherry, andreya triana and radio 1 dj b.traits are among other female acts to be announced by bestival.
Organiser rob da bank said: "there are shed-loads of amazing people making some startlingly good music at the moment and look, lots of them are female."
This year's bestival theme is summer of love.
It takes place at robin hill country park on the isle of wight between 10 and 13 september, with 25 stages on offer.
Follow @bbcnewsbeat on twitter and radio1newsbeat on youtube
summary: Bestival, an annual music festival held on the Isle of Wight, has announced its second wave of performers, which includes an all-female lineup. The festival's organizer, Rob da Bank, said that there are many talented female musicians making great music at the moment, and this year's theme is Summer of Love. The festival will take place at Robin Hill Country Park from September 10-13, and will feature 25 stages.
