title: XSUM-31763768:llama7b-ul2
source:
Bestival has revealed an all-female line-up in its second wave of announcements for this year's isle of wight event.
Charli xcx, ella eyre and lianne la havas will appear alongside the chemical brothers and underworld.
Other festivals have been criticised for the lack of women on their bills.
Last week, music blog crack in the road posted images of edited posters removing all the names of male performers.
The rather blank-looking page was shared on social media, with the bills at reading and leeds, download and t in the park also a focus for criticism.
Neneh cherry, andreya triana and radio 1 dj b.traits are among other female acts to be announced by bestival.
Organiser rob da bank said: "there are shed-loads of amazing people making some startlingly good music at the moment and look, lots of them are female."
This year's bestival theme is summer of love.
It takes place at robin hill country park on the isle of wight between 10 and 13 september, with 25 stages on offer.
Follow @bbcnewsbeat on twitter and radio1newsbeat on youtube
summary: Bestival has announced an all-female lineup for its second wave of acts, including Charli XCX, Ella Eyre, and Lianne La Havas. This comes after other festivals have faced criticism for lacking female acts on their lineups. Organizer Rob da Bank said there are many talented female musicians making great music right now, and he's proud to have them on the bill. The festival takes place on the Isle of Wight from September 10-13 with 25 stages.

title: XSUM-19389161:gpt4-ul2
source:
Indian olympics bronze medallist, boxer mc mary kom, has welcomed a film that bollywood director sanjay leela bhansali wants to make on her life.
"this film will help bridge the gap between people of the indian mainland and those from the north-eastern states," mary kom told the bbc.
The five-time world champion is from the remote northeast state of manipur.
Bhansali, who has been planning the film for a year, described the boxer as an "inspiration to every indian woman".
"i am very impressed with the way mary kom is leading her life with so much conviction and courage.
We'll start working on the film very soon.
I haven't decided on who will play her role," bhansali told the bbc.
Recently, thousands of north-eastern people fled the indian cities of mumbai, bangalore and hyderabad fearing reprisal attacks in the wake of ethnic clashes between bodo tribes and muslims in the north-eastern state of assam.
The boxer says she has been worried about her relatives and friends living in bangalore and "could not properly sleep at night when this exodus was taking place".
The mother of twin boys feels that bhansali's film on her will help clear the air because "our people look different but they are indians.
We have the same passions when the country is involved".
Bhansali's assistant omung kumar, who researched mary kom's life and wrote the script, will direct the film.
But will it be possible to screen the movie in the boxer's home state manipur, where separatist rebels have imposed a ban on bollywood films?
"i hope nobody will object to a film if it centres on my life story, my struggles to become a boxer," mary kom said.
India's thriving film industry has rarely picked on themes from the country's long-embattled north-eastern states and the few films that have been made have focused on the separatist insurgencies and india's counter-insurgency efforts in the region.
summary: Indian Olympic bronze medallist and boxer MC Mary Kom has given her approval for a film about her life to be made by Bollywood director Sanjay Leela Bhansali. She believes the movie will foster understanding between the Indian mainland and its northeastern states. Bhansali, who considers Mary Kom an inspiration to all Indian women, has been planning the biopic for a year. Despite ongoing discord between different ethnic groups in the northeast, Mary Kom is hopeful that Bhansali's film — being directed by his assistant Omung Kumar — will be allowed to screen in her home state of Manipur, where Bollywood movies are currently banned due to separatist rebellions.

title: XSUM-35455958:gpt4-ul2
source:
Derry football manager damian barton has described the facial injury sustained by his player brendan rogers in last weekend's dr mckenna cup final as "horrific".
Media playback is not supported on this device rogers needed 14 stitches in his lip after a challenge by tyrone's tiernan mccann at the start of the game.
"i think brendan was quite shocked.
Some people were quite horrified," said the derry manager.
"i'll leave it to other people to make up their minds."
The slaughtneil man had the stitches inserted last sunday and barton expects rogers to be out of action for a couple of more weeks.
Rogers was named at midfield for the mckenna cup final and the match video suggested he may have been caught by mccann's right elbow immediately after challenging for the initial throw-in.
After the ball was thrown in, mccann came in from the side and the footage showed the tyrone man clattering into rogers although the red hand county player appeared to be focusing on the ball rather than the derry midfielder when the contact was made.
"brendan has been very quiet about it and we have been very quiet about it as well," said barton after derry's opening 3-13 to 1-10 division 2 football league victory over fermanagh at celtic park.
"it was quite an horrific incident.
I wouldn't like to expand on it to be quite frank.
Media playback is not supported on this device "it was an incident that thankfully you don't see very often."
Barton added that he "couldn't speak" after the game such was his upset about the incident.
"i think it affected the mood of all of us.
"it overshadowed for me what was a positive night for football.
"i think the amount of respect that was shown between derry and tyrone was very evident but it's one of those things i'll let people make up their own minds about."
In terms of sunday's opening league win, barton felt that his team had laboured badly in the first half before going on to clinch a nine-point victory over the erne county.
"we were very flat at the start of the game.
We turned over a serious amount of ball under no pressure.
"i was glad to see our first goal going in (before half-time) and i was very happy to see half-time because it gave us an opportunity to restructure and talk about what we felt we were going wrong.
"getting in the ball in early in the second half to our men inside worked nicely in the inclement conditions but we'll have to up our performances over the next couple of weeks."
summary: Derry football manager, Damian Barton, has publicly described the serious injury sustained by Brendan Rogers during last weekend's Dr. McKenna Cup final as "horrific." Rogers needed to have 14 stitches in his lip following a run-in with Tyrone's Tiernan McCann at the start of the match. It is expected that Rogers will be unable to play for another couple of weeks. The incident has reportedly upset the entire team and overshadowed their 3-13 to 1-10 victory over Fermanagh in the league opening.

title: REDDIT-34:gpt4-ul2
source:
I work in a secure mental health hospital in the uk.
I typically work night shifts and last night i was getting peckish.
I thought to myself i'll pop some toast in and quickly go do my observations, by the time i'm back it will be ready.
As i'm doing my checks a couple of patients asked me to do some little things for them and i assist them, completely forgetting about my toast.
Next thing i know, the fire alarms are ringing.
See the interesting thing about secure door locks is that they become unlocked in the event of a fire, to allow people to get out the building, and well, the interesting thing about secure hospitals is that they are supposed to be locked... for the briefest of moments i was confused, then suddenly it dawned on me.
Toast.
I ran to the staff room (which, previously only accessible by staff,  was now open to all as the internal locks are released too) and found smoke billowing from the toaster and a patient sat next to it laughing and munching his way through the black charcoal blocks that remained of my snack.
Luckily, we managed to secure the building, reset the alarm and escort the patient back to his room with no harm done.
One patient however did manage to get out the building however and had to be picked up by police later in the night.
Lesson to self, no more toast on night shift.
Safe to say my manager was not impressed.
summary: The author, who works night shifts at a secure mental health hospital in the UK, narrates an incident where he toasted bread for a snack during his shift and then got distracted by some patients' requests. In the meantime, the toast got burned and triggered the fire alarms. The secure door locks, designed to unlock automatically in case of fire to allow for evacuation, opened. This allowed patients access to areas usually locked, including the staff room where the toast was burning. One patient was found in the staff room enjoying the burnt toast. The staff were able to secure the building and reset the alarms without harm, but one patient managed to escape the facility and was later apprehended by the police.

title: REDDIT-37:gpt4-ul2
source:
Context: i've recently come down with a pretty nasty ear infection, that just seems to get worse.
On the first day, my inner ear felt congested, and flared up in pain when i bit down on anything.
Obviously, i decide to head to a clinic, and was promptly diagnosed with an inner ear infection.
On the second day, i felt lightheaded and dizzy, but decided to push on through.
However, by the third day, i was starting to feel queasy, and heavily feverish.
I checked my temp with an oral thermometer, and, just as i suspected, i was running a low fever.
Now, here's where the tifu starts.
A couple weeks back, i made plans with a friend to go see justice league.
We were both pretty hyped up, because we're pretty big fans of the characters.
Even though i was feeling pretty shitty, i decided to go through with our  plans, and go anyways.
I had started to feel a little better by the time noon rolled around, so i thought i could keep it together until i got back home.
Boy, was i wrong.
When we got to the theater, my fever had slowly started to return, along with a stomach ache.
It started out pretty mild, but slowly progressed.
By the midway point, i was barely keeping it together.
Around the setup to the climax, i could feel my throat burning, and my stomach rumbling like a geyser, preparing to erupt.
And erupt it did... as i was starting to get ready to make a break for the bathroom, the inevitable time bomb that was my gut finally exploded.
Thanks to the advice i'd gotten about staying hydrated, the nearly-endless stream of vomit that shot out of my mouth was extra liquidy, leading to an ever growing puddle of puke, swelling up around my shoes.
Quickly, the soupy stream of spew made it's way down the isle, alerting everyone that hadn't already noticed the atrocity i had just committed before them.
Soon came an endless torrent of remarks, such as "geez, why's it all wet here?
", "who just spilled their drink?"
"why is my shoe so moist?"
And many more.
Eventually, the ushers had become aware of the mess i had  just jettisoned from my throat, and started evacuating the theater.
I couldn't make eye contact with my friend, as i rushed back to my car to speed home.
summary: The document describes an unfortunate event where the author went to watch a movie in a theater, even though they were suffering from a severe ear infection and subjective symptoms involving lightheadedness, nausea, and fever. Despite beginning to feel better, their symptoms returned at the theater, culminating in them vomiting in the middle of the film - creating a messy situation that led to the theater being evacuated. Embarrassed by the incident, the author immediately left for home without even making eye contact with their friend.

title: REDDIT-13:llama70b-ul2
source:
So unlike the majority of posts i see here this actually happened today (woah, what!?)
And it left me feeling like i had just ruined the childhood of my cousin.
  so, this fu happened at a casual family breakfast where we had our extended family over.
Anyway, my father asks my uncle, his brother, what he had planned over the easter break and of course as soon as someone mentions easter, the younger kids start getting all excited over the fact that easter is around the corner and about how they're going to "get all the easter eggs and chocolate, even yours, you don't need it you're fat, the easter bunny won't visit you because you don't need them!"
And so on.
Anyway, i find it humorous for about 10 minutes (i should probably mention that i'm not a large fan of young children, i get easily frustrated after too much obnoxiousness, kids man, they can't help it) so i end up going upstairs to my room, unfortunately my cousin ended up following me and continued the tirade of insults, purely innocent and i wasn't the least bit offended by what he was saying, i was laughing along with him but here was where i fucked up.
I ended up saying something along the lines of 'okay that's enough now, how do you know the easter bunny is even real?'
As a joke and i made it clear as soon as i said it that i was just kidding and that if he acts up the easter bunny won't come.
But fuck me man, i'd already done it.
  he then says to me "but if you haven't seen him, then he can't be real....", completely missing the point mind you but his personality is very stubborn and isn't easily swayed.
Once he gets something in his head, it's almost impossible to convince him otherwise.
I didn't know what to say cause i already know what this kid is like and i had just gone and given my aunt and uncle a very difficult task of trying to convince him that there is, in fact, an easter bunny.
He was crying when he came to this conclusion and ran downstairs to his parents telling them his discovery, to which they gave me the biggest death stare i had ever gotten.
To my dismay, he didn't stop there, the next sentence left me feeling like an absolute cunt.
He says "but if there is no easter bunny then santa clause, the tooth fairy and jesus can't be real either!"
(not going to lie, it took everything i had in me not to laugh when he mentioned jesus).
Anyway, the result is that my parents hate me, my aunt and uncle despise me and i doubt anyone in my family will ever speak to me again, guess it's time to revert back to my reclusive existence because family interaction is now a thing of the past.
summary: A person shared a story about how they inadvertently ruined their cousin's belief in the Easter Bunny during a family breakfast. They made a comment questioning the bunny's existence, which led their cousin to cry and run to their parents, who gave the person a death stare. The cousin then went on to question the existence of other figures, such as Santa Claus, the tooth fairy, and Jesus, leaving the person feeling embarrassed and isolated from their family.

title: REDDIT-39:llama70b-ul2
source:
One day, when i was a lot younger (although not as young as i wish i had been) my parents had decided to take us to the beach.
From where we lived that was quite a drive.
So there i am sitting in the back seat being a bored little kid, and doing what bored little kids do i started getting creative.
I had a crayon and in the back seat was an ash tray and a cigarette lighter.
So i came up with a plan for melting the crayon and doing...probably something equally as dumb with it.
For some reason i thought the lighters just came out hot, so i just pulled it out and stuck it on the bottom of the ash tray and held it there a good few minutes.
Nothing happened of course.
I decide to see how hot it is by touching the tip with my finger.
Pretty cool so i put it back in and wait for it to warm up, thinking that's how those worked.
Pulled it out and tested it with my finger again and nothing.
I saw that it had a piece that moved on a spring so i moved it around, touched the tip and yet still nothing.
Must be broken!
My dumb child brain thought.
So i gave up just put it back in.
Then i realized i could push the lighter in.
So i did.
And of course because my childhood self was a scientist at heart and knew that when doing an experiment you must follow every step exactly, i tested how hot it was on my finger.
And that is how i ruined our trip to the beach and got a target branded on my finger.
summary: A child, who was bored during a car ride to the beach, decided to play with a lighter and an ash tray. They tried to melt a crayon and ended up burning themselves when they touched the lighter's hot tip. After the incident, the child's finger had a target-like burn mark.

So this just happened a couple of hours ago.
On the way back from a doctors apt we were on a divided highway.
The traffic was backed up at a stop light and we were in the far left lane.
Where we should have stopped would have blocked a turn lane from the other side of the highway.
My gf stopped far enough back to let the car waiting to turn pull out.
I remarked that she should just pull up because that guy shouldnt turn anyways due to not being able to see the other two lanes of traffic.
She replied saying that she was taught to never block an intersection.
I was explaining that it wasnt really an intersection as the dumbass waiting to turn started to go.
As i looked in the side mirror i noticed a car rapidly approaching in the middle lane.
I reached over to honk but it was too late.
Dumbass got hit in his rear quarter panel and spun all the way around.
Everyone was ok but it all could have been avoided had i just insisted that my gf pull up to block the turn lane.
Though that would have had her angry at me rather than ashamed that she allowed the accident to happen.
summary: On their journey, the author and his girlfriend got caught in heavy traffic on a divided highway. Despite a motorist waiting to turn from the opposite direction, the girlfriend held back to avoid blockage, adhering to her personal principle of not blocking an intersection. The author believed, however, that the waiting driver should not turn due to lack of visibility of the other lanes. While they argued over this, the waiting motorist decided to turn and was hit by an approaching car from the middle lane. All parties involved were unharaped, however, the author reflected that the accident could have been avoided if he had insisted that his girlfriend block the turn lane.

title: XSUM-12889429:llama7b-ul2
source:
Mining giant rio tinto has lowered its minimum acceptances target slightly in a last ditch effort to takeover south africa's riversdale mining.
Rio's offer of 16.50 australian dollars ($16.42; â£10.14) is now conditional on 47% of shareholders accepting it by 6 april.
Previously its minimum target was 50%.
The move came after talks on the a$3.9bn offer between rio and riversdale major shareholder, brazil's csn.
If it fails to reach the new threshold, rio tinto will pay riversdale shareholders only a$16 a share.
So far only 41% have said yes.
The other key shareholder in riversdale is tata steel of india, which recently increased its stake to 27% and also has a director on the company's board.
Csn, brazil's largest steelmaker, has also increased its riversdale stake to 19.9%.
summary: Rio Tinto has lowered its minimum acceptance target for its A$3.9 billion takeover offer of Riversdale Mining to 47% from 50%. The new offer is conditional on 47% of shareholders accepting it by April 6. If the offer fails to reach the new threshold, Rio Tinto will pay Riversdale shareholders only A$16 per share. So far, only 41% of shareholders have accepted the offer. The other key shareholders in Riversdale include Tata Steel of India and CSN, Brazil's largest steelmaker, which has increased its stake to 19.9%.

title: REDDIT-78:llama70b-ul2
source:
Some background information first; i'm in high school so the whole dating thing is kind of new to me.
I've known her for a while but i have just recently started talking to her a good amount the last year.
So the obligatory it didn't happen today, but last october.
So there was this girl i liked.
Let's call her sarah.
So some of my friends have a hunch that i liked her, but i never really admitted it.
I had been debating asking her but i decided against it because i figured it wouldn't end well.
But at home coming, i finally gave in and went for it.
I went up and asked her if she'd want to go see the new (at the time) divergent movie with me on friday.
She was so shocked she had no idea what to say.
She responded to me asking her out with "well i guess i can't say no".
Not a good sign, but at that point i don't care.
My friends are all happy for me and i have a good rest of home coming.
Fast forward to thursday morning, in science class.
The only class i have with her.
She keeps bringing up how she feels like she's going to get sick.
I'm thinking maybe she's just trying to get out of it.
Friday comes and she's not at school.
I tried texting her but no response.
(the next monday i learn she broke her phone) i'm pretty upset at this point.
One of my friends that's known for inviting himself to this sort of thing thinks it's a good idea to invite himself and a few friends.
So we get to the theatre and there i am.
Alone, with no idea where she is or what happened.
My friend who invited himself is having a good time with the people he invited while i sat there eating my candy wanting to leave already.
Now days we're friends and we laugh about it.
Never going to forget this first date.
summary: A high school student asked a girl out on a date to see the movie "Divergent" and she accepted. However, on the day of the date, the girl didn't show up and the boy was left sitting alone at the theater, feeling upset. It turned out that the girl had broken her phone and wasn't able to respond to his texts. Despite the disappointing first date, the two remained friends and can now laugh about the experience.

title: REDDIT-76:mistral7b-ul2
source:
It's my wife's birthday in 2 weeks so i decided to buy her something really nice.
Yesterday while she was out on an errand i snuck out and bought a very expensive cartier item, making it back home before she got back.
This morning she wakes me up and shows me her phone with a worried look on her face.
On it there's a message from her bank warning her that a very large purchase was made on her credit card.
I jump out of bed, yelling "what the fuck!"
And grab my wallet, finding inside my wife's, identical to my own, credit card rather than my card.
The night before we went to dinner and must have switched our cards after paying.
Kinda shocked that cartier didn't bother to check the name on the card as we have completely different names.
summary: The document describes the situation where the author bought a very expensive Cartier item for his wife as a surprise for her birthday, but the next day he found out that a large purchase had been made on her credit card. Upon investigation, he realized that he had used his own credit card instead of his wife's, which had been mistakenly switched during a dinner outing. The author expresses shock that the store did not verify the name on the card before making the purchase.

title: REDDIT-17:llama7b-ul2
source:
So this just happened a couple of hours ago.
On the way back from a doctors apt we were on a divided highway.
The traffic was backed up at a stop light and we were in the far left lane.
Where we should have stopped would have blocked a turn lane from the other side of the highway.
My gf stopped far enough back to let the car waiting to turn pull out.
I remarked that she should just pull up because that guy shouldnt turn anyways due to not being able to see the other two lanes of traffic.
She replied saying that she was taught to never block an intersection.
I was explaining that it wasnt really an intersection as the dumbass waiting to turn started to go.
As i looked in the side mirror i noticed a car rapidly approaching in the middle lane.
I reached over to honk but it was too late.
Dumbass got hit in his rear quarter panel and spun all the way around.
Everyone was ok but it all could have been avoided had i just insisted that my gf pull up to block the turn lane.
Though that would have had her angry at me rather than ashamed that she allowed the accident to happen.
summary: A couple was on their way back from a doctor's appointment when they were involved in a near-accident on a divided highway. The couple's girlfriend stopped far back to let a car turning onto the highway pull out, but the driver of the car that was hit in the rear quarter panel and spun around argued that she should have blocked the turn lane to avoid the accident. The driver of the car was angry at the girlfriend, but the driver of the car that was hit was okay. The driver of the car that was hit could have avoided the accident if they had been paying attention and not tried to turn into a lane where they could not see the other two lanes of traffic.

spans.text: the driver of the car that was hit

title: REDDIT-39:geminipro-ul2
source:
One day, when i was a lot younger (although not as young as i wish i had been) my parents had decided to take us to the beach.
From where we lived that was quite a drive.
So there i am sitting in the back seat being a bored little kid, and doing what bored little kids do i started getting creative.
I had a crayon and in the back seat was an ash tray and a cigarette lighter.
So i came up with a plan for melting the crayon and doing...probably something equally as dumb with it.
For some reason i thought the lighters just came out hot, so i just pulled it out and stuck it on the bottom of the ash tray and held it there a good few minutes.
Nothing happened of course.
I decide to see how hot it is by touching the tip with my finger.
Pretty cool so i put it back in and wait for it to warm up, thinking that's how those worked.
Pulled it out and tested it with my finger again and nothing.
I saw that it had a piece that moved on a spring so i moved it around, touched the tip and yet still nothing.
Must be broken!
My dumb child brain thought.
So i gave up just put it back in.
Then i realized i could push the lighter in.
So i did.
And of course because my childhood self was a scientist at heart and knew that when doing an experiment you must follow every step exactly, i tested how hot it was on my finger.
And that is how i ruined our trip to the beach and got a target branded on my finger.
summary: During a long car ride to the beach as a child, the narrator became bored and decided to experiment with a crayon and a cigarette lighter in the back seat. Despite multiple attempts, the narrator could not get the lighter to produce heat. Frustrated, the narrator pushed the lighter in and accidentally burned their finger, leaving a target-shaped brand.

title: REDDIT-13:llama7b-ul2
source:
So unlike the majority of posts i see here this actually happened today (woah, what!?)
And it left me feeling like i had just ruined the childhood of my cousin.
  so, this fu happened at a casual family breakfast where we had our extended family over.
Anyway, my father asks my uncle, his brother, what he had planned over the easter break and of course as soon as someone mentions easter, the younger kids start getting all excited over the fact that easter is around the corner and about how they're going to "get all the easter eggs and chocolate, even yours, you don't need it you're fat, the easter bunny won't visit you because you don't need them!"
And so on.
Anyway, i find it humorous for about 10 minutes (i should probably mention that i'm not a large fan of young children, i get easily frustrated after too much obnoxiousness, kids man, they can't help it) so i end up going upstairs to my room, unfortunately my cousin ended up following me and continued the tirade of insults, purely innocent and i wasn't the least bit offended by what he was saying, i was laughing along with him but here was where i fucked up.
I ended up saying something along the lines of 'okay that's enough now, how do you know the easter bunny is even real?'
As a joke and i made it clear as soon as i said it that i was just kidding and that if he acts up the easter bunny won't come.
But fuck me man, i'd already done it.
  he then says to me "but if you haven't seen him, then he can't be real....", completely missing the point mind you but his personality is very stubborn and isn't easily swayed.
Once he gets something in his head, it's almost impossible to convince him otherwise.
I didn't know what to say cause i already know what this kid is like and i had just gone and given my aunt and uncle a very difficult task of trying to convince him that there is, in fact, an easter bunny.
He was crying when he came to this conclusion and ran downstairs to his parents telling them his discovery, to which they gave me the biggest death stare i had ever gotten.
To my dismay, he didn't stop there, the next sentence left me feeling like an absolute cunt.
He says "but if there is no easter bunny then santa clause, the tooth fairy and jesus can't be real either!"
(not going to lie, it took everything i had in me not to laugh when he mentioned jesus).
Anyway, the result is that my parents hate me, my aunt and uncle despise me and i doubt anyone in my family will ever speak to me again, guess it's time to revert back to my reclusive existence because family interaction is now a thing of the past.
summary: A person wrote about an incident where they questioned the existence of the Easter Bunny in front of a young child, leading to the child becoming upset and eventually concluding that if the Easter Bunny is not real, then other fictional characters like Santa Claus and the Tooth Fairy are also not real. The writer feels guilty for upsetting the child and fears that they may lose their relationship with their family as a result.

title: REDDIT-34:mistral7b-ul2
source:
I work in a secure mental health hospital in the uk.
I typically work night shifts and last night i was getting peckish.
I thought to myself i'll pop some toast in and quickly go do my observations, by the time i'm back it will be ready.
As i'm doing my checks a couple of patients asked me to do some little things for them and i assist them, completely forgetting about my toast.
Next thing i know, the fire alarms are ringing.
See the interesting thing about secure door locks is that they become unlocked in the event of a fire, to allow people to get out the building, and well, the interesting thing about secure hospitals is that they are supposed to be locked... for the briefest of moments i was confused, then suddenly it dawned on me.
Toast.
I ran to the staff room (which, previously only accessible by staff,  was now open to all as the internal locks are released too) and found smoke billowing from the toaster and a patient sat next to it laughing and munching his way through the black charcoal blocks that remained of my snack.
Luckily, we managed to secure the building, reset the alarm and escort the patient back to his room with no harm done.
One patient however did manage to get out the building however and had to be picked up by police later in the night.
Lesson to self, no more toast on night shift.
Safe to say my manager was not impressed.
summary: The document describes the author's experience working as a mental health professional in a secure hospital in the UK. The author typically works night shifts and got peckish while doing their observations. They quickly went to make toast and assisted patients with small tasks, forgetting about their snack. When the fire alarms went off, the author was confused, but realized they needed to secure the building and escort the patients back to their rooms. One patient managed to escape and had to be picked up by police. The author learned that they should not have toast on night shift and their manager was likely not impressed with their performance.

title: REDDIT-83:llama7b-ul2
source:
Both me and my girlfriend participate in winter sports at our highschool, i swim and she fences.
Today was a late meet for me (8pm meet) and it is a rule we must dress up for a meet.
My girlfriend has a normal practice today, normally school gets out at 3:02 and her practice is at 3:15. she has to get changed so i wait outside the locker rooms for her so i could give her a kiss goodbye.
What i don''t realize is that my bus leaves while i''m standing outside the locker rooms.
Being a slow dresser she is in there till the last minute.
After she comes out i give her a kiss goodbye and walk outside.
There was nothing, nobody, but the steady snow fall.
Naturally i freak out and start making calls, my friend says he got dropped off already so i call my house... no answer.. my parents and older sister are working so no answer from them.. now i''m paying the price with a 6 mile walk hold in freezing temperatures in my thin dress shirt and no gloves or hat.
Wish me luck!
!
summary: The writer and their girlfriend are both involved in winter sports at their high school. Today, the writer is late for their bus and doesn''t realize that their girlfriend is still in the locker room until she comes out. The writer is left standing outside in the cold and snow without a way to get home, so they start making calls to try to find a ride. However, no one is available to pick them up, leaving the writer to walk home in freezing temperatures.

title: XSUM-35441162:llama7b-ul2
source:
Claims direct cross-border rail services could be under threat due to devolution have been dismissed by wales' transport minister.
Edwina hart accused uk officials of "ignorance" amid suggestions passengers could have to change trains on some services between wales and england.
Responsibility for the wales and border network will be devolved in 2017.
A department of transport spokesman said no decisions would be made without considering local views.
Services from aberystwyth to birmingham and milford haven to manchester via cardiff, are among routes which could be affected.
In last year's st david's day agreement, the uk government wrote: "in order for the secretary of state for transport to ensure proper accountability, it is likely that services primarily serving english markets will be placed into other franchises for which the secretary of state for transport is the franchising authority".
Responding to suggestions some passengers may have to change trains on cross-border routes, mrs hart said some whitehall officials "don't actually understand how things work and what are important".
"i base some of their comments on ignorance rather than a conspiracy theory," she said.
"we want to ensure those services remain within the franchise."
John rogers from campaign group railfutures wales said: "it's ludicrous, it's impractical, it's being done behind the scenes with a lot of secrecy initially and we're determined to fight it".
"it's not in the interests of passengers.
People hate changing trains, it's a deterrent and it would affect the tourist industry," he added.
A department for transport spokesman said: "we are working closely with the welsh government to develop plans for cross-border routes and stations as we move towards devolving the next wales and border franchise".
summary: Wales' Transport Minister, Edwina Hart, has dismissed claims that direct cross-border rail services could be under threat due to devolution. She accused UK officials of ignorance and stated that the Welsh government wants to ensure services remain within the franchise. A campaign group, Railfutures Wales, is opposed to the idea of passengers having to change trains on some cross-border routes and fears it would affect the tourist industry. The Department for Transport has stated that they are working closely with the Welsh government to develop plans for these routes and stations.

title: XSUM-32915014:geminipro-ul2
source:
Gopro's chief executive has confirmed it will make its own quadcopter drones.
Nick woodman described the remote controlled aircraft as the "ultimate" accessory for his firm's action cameras.
He made the announcement at the code conference in california, where he also unveiled new kit to that helps capture video footage for virtual reality helmets.
One industry watcher said gopro's move into drones was "very significant".
"it's the fact that the company has such a strong brand," explained john stapley from amateur photographer magazine.
"it's similar to what you can already see with action cameras.
There are a lot of others out there but most people don't know they exist or don't have any interest in them because gopro has become such a dominant name that it is 'the action brand' as far as they are concerned."
The risk for the firm, he added, was that other drone manufacturers would opt to partner with other camera makers to avoid supporting a competitor.
The world's bestselling commercial drone maker - china's dji - has already decided to limit initial sales of its phantom 3 flagship to a design that features its own proprietary video camera.
The previous generation had been launched instead with an optional mount for gopro cams.
Mr woodman said he planned to release the gopro drone within the first half of 2016, and that it would be targeted at consumers.
"quadcopters have a special place for us at gopro because i was a huge radio-controlled plane enthusiast as a kid and i could never really get anyone involved in it with me because it was either too geeky or it took a lot of time to learn how to fly these things - you'd crash them all the time," he said.
"so, i was really surprised to see how quickly the general consumer was adopting quadcopters.
"quads plus gopro has been one of the most democratising combinations in terms of enabling people to capture professional quality content and see themselves in their environment in a way that they'd never seen before.
It looks like you're in your own movie."
Drones are expected to be one of the fastest growing electronics sectors over the coming years.
According to the us's consumer electronics association, the global market for consumer drones totalled $84m (â£54m) last year but is forecast to top $300m by 2018.
The cea adds that if regulators relax the rules for the use of such aircraft by commercial organisations, the market could further swell to $1bn by 2020.
That could represent a lucrative new market for gopro.
The firm's existing cameras and other accessories generated $363m of sales over the first three months of 2015.
That was up 54% on the previous year, but resulted in a relatively slim net profit of $16.8m.
Mr woodman also showed off a prototype mount that can hold six of his firm's hero4 cameras, each pointing in a different direction.
He said the resulting footage could be stitched together using software developed by kolor - a start-up it bought last month - to create a single 6k-quality 360-degree image.
This could then be used with virtual reality helmets - allowing a user to change their perspective by turning their head left and right and looking up and down - or via youtube and facebook, which are both adding support for interactive spherical videos.
The six-camera spherical array add-on will go on sale later this year.
Mr woodman acknowledged, however, that the high cost of buying enough cameras to fill it was likely to limit the mount's appeal to professionals.
At a subsequent event, google also announced a more elaborate virtual reality capture device, which involves 16 gopro cameras, as part of a tie-up between the two companies.
The footage produced by the jump camera array will be processed by the search firm's own software to produce panoramas, rather than spherical videos, that make use of depth data deduced by google's algorithms.
summary: GoPro, the action camera company, has announced plans to release its own quadcopter drone in the first half of 2016. The drone will be targeted at consumers and priced accordingly. CEO Nick Woodman sees quadcopters as a perfect companion for GoPro cameras, enabling users to capture professional-quality footage from unique perspectives. The drone market is expected to grow significantly in the coming years, and GoPro hopes to capitalize on this trend. The company also unveiled a prototype mount that can hold six GoPro cameras to capture 360-degree footage, which can be used with virtual reality (VR) headsets. However, the high cost of the mount is likely to limit its appeal to professionals.

summary: Jerry, a 45-year-old man, suffered an ankle injury while playing basketball with his son. He experienced pain, swelling, and difficulty walking. An X-ray revealed a displaced lateral malleolus fracture at the Weber C level. The doctor diagnosed a lateral malleolar fracture and recommended surgery to repair the fracture with a plate and screws. title: REDDIT-12:gpt4-ul2
source:
This was about a week or two ago but i still think i should share this with you guys.
I was at football practice.
It was the first day of spring practice and i was practicing for qb (quarterbacks throw the ball for people who don't keep up with sports).
I practiced the whole day, got dehydrated and ended up almost passing out.
I asked a coach to go get water but he told me to continue to do the rest of the sprints.
Anyways, it became the end of the day.
It was time for me to practice with the whole offense.
I got in the huddle, called "flex right 2" and the just said "break?
".
For people who don't know, that's not how you do a huddle, this is how you do a huddle: 1) make sure your center is looking at you; make sure your huddle is worth something 2) make sure all eyes are on you 3) say the play twice on both sides of the huddle 4) say "ready, break" i figured it out and i got in position.
I said, "ready go" and the center snapped me the ball.
Now listen, i have no idea what i just called in the huddle.
I just copied exactly what coach told me to say but i didn't know what "flex right 2" was.
So, i got the snap, i looked to my right, and threw the ball to the right outside wide receiver.
I was so proud of myself.
"i threw an accurate pass to the wr and coach will be proud!!"
I thought.
Then the offensive line gets up and says, "didn't he say two?"
I thought, "yeah i said two?"
So i get back in the huddle, and i asked coach, "did i do something wrong?"
"hell yeah!"
He yelled, "you threw on a run play!"
Instantly, i thought i was going to get kicked off the team.
The only thing i could do was say, "i'm so sorry," about 30 times.
I ended up getting yelled at, told if i do that again, i was being moved to another position, and i got laughed at and made fun of for the rest of the week and still even today by other players and friends.
So i quit.
I talked to my coach about it and since he knows i want to play guitar and film more, he offered a shot to go back during the fall and actually film the games!
Then he said if i want to make a career out of it, he could call his good friend from south carolina to possibly get me scholarship money to go down there and film the games.
summary: The document is a narration of the author's experience at a football practice. During his first spring practice as a quarterback, the author ended up dehydrated and almost passed out but was told by the coach to complete the sprints. At the end of the day, he was instructed to lead a huddle and call a play. However, due to lack of knowledge, he made a mistake by throwing the ball on a run play, which resulted in his coach's disappointment and ridicule from his teammates. The author decided to quit practicing and expressed his interest in playing guitar and filming. His coach then offered him an opportunity to film their football games in the future and proposed connecting him with a friend in South Carolina for a potential scholarship in filming games.

title: XSUM-34774405:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Russia is not the only country with systemic doping problems, says uk athletics chairman ed warner.
Media playback is not supported on this device a world anti-doping agency commission report has accused russia of running a "state-sponsored" doping programme.
And warner said he feels sports other than athletics have reason to be concerned at how russian sport is run.
"this iceberg spreads in two different directions," he said.
"i suspect there are probably four, five or six nations that athletics has a problem with."
Commission chairman dick pound said russia's athletics federation, araf, should be banned from the rio 2016 olympics.
Warner told bbc radio 5 live: "every other international sport today should be looking at russian sport and looking at whether the men and women who compete in their events are clean."
"they do not have robust anti-doping regimes.
They are asleep on the job - and they have to be rooted out."
Wada's independent commission, which examined allegations of doping, cover-ups and extortion in russian athletics, also implicated the international association of athletics' federations.
The iaaf's former president lamine diack has been provisionally suspended by the international olympic committee, who have also asked the iaaf to start disciplinary action against the athletes named in the report.
Araf has been told to respond to the report by friday and russia have defended their position.
Acting head of russia athletics federation, vadim zelichenok, said: "there is an element of a political hit job here because quite a few things were described in the report in a biased way."
Russia's sports ministry has said it will work more closely with wada, igor zagorskiy, deputy director of the russian anti-doping agency, rusada, told the bbc: "there is always room for improvement.
"we are on that track and we've been on that track together with wada.
We will continue this work on this."
Warner says the international association of athletics federations (iaaf), must be restructured to combat the problem.
He revealed that he had spoken to iaaf president lord coe since monday's publication of wada's independent commission, which examined allegations of doping, cover-ups and extortion in russian athletics, and also implicated the iaaf.
The 323-page report said that "acceptance of cheating at all levels is widespread" in russia and suggested that neither araf, rusada, nor the russian federation can be considered anti-doping code-compliant.
The report also said the london 2012 olympics were "sabotaged" by "widespread inaction" against athletes with suspicious doping profiles; accuses moscow laboratory director grigory rodchenko of asking for and accepting bribes and intentionally destroying samples he was told to keep; and recommends that five russian athletes and five coaches should be given lifetime doping bans.
Media playback is not supported on this device pound, who chaired the wada investigation, said the situation was "worse than we thought", adding that "it may be a residue of the old soviet union system".
Warner backed the recommendation to suspend russia from competition "until they put their house in order", adding: "if you punish one or two innocent russian athletes for the greater good of the sport, that is a moral dilemma i am willing to grasp."
He also suggested that russia is unlikely to be the only country guilty of doping, saying that "athletics has probably got some other nations to root out".
He added that while "there are undoubtedly drugs cheats in many corners of athletics", he believed systemic doping did not occur in nations in the western world.
During a special bbc radio 5 live programme examining the independent report, britain's marathon world record holder paula radcliffe said: "i don't think anyone is under the impression it's only russia."
On the same programme, former british sprinter darren campbell warned of "darker days to come".
He said: "this report was about russia, and they need to be punished if this holds up, but we'll lose sight on the bigger issues if we focus on russia.
It's about cleaning everything out.
"there's people talking about testing out in kenya and jamaica.
We can't have rumours anymore.
"we need to understand how the russians got away with it.
How did this happen yet nobody knew?
"no matter how dark and depressing it gets, change has to happen now."
Coe, elected iaaf president in august, described the wada report as "alarming" and has said he will seek urgent approval from members to consider sanctions against the russian federation.
The report found evidence of multiple rules breaches by iaaf officials and found the governing body to be "inexplicably lax in following up suspicious blood (and other) profiles".
Media playback is not supported on this device it has also been criticised for its handling of the allegations, with coe himself describing claims about suspicious blood profiles involving some athletes as "a declaration of war on my sport" in august.
On monday, coe said that "if there are failings in our governance or our anti-doping programme i will fix them".
But warner says coe needs to restructure the iaaf in order for it to effectively tackle the problem.
"this cannot be a one-man crusade," warner told bbc radio 4's today programme.
"he needs to ensure there is a bench around him at the iaaf who dramatically improve the operation.
"we all know, and he has already said, he needs to go out and hire a good chief executive.
"it needs more than that.
He also possibly needs a chairman under him so he can take the lead of the elected council and be the ambassador for the sport and have full-time professional staff, possibly from outside sport, from elsewhere in business, who can get a grip on the organisation."
summary: The document discusses the problem of systemic doping in Russian athletics and its impact on international sports. UK Athletics Chairman Ed Warner and commission chairman Dick Pound have expressed concern about the issue, with Pound recommending that Russia's athletics federation, Araf, be banned from the Rio 2016 Olympics. Warner has called on all international sports to be cautious about Russian athletes and has suggested that the International Association of Athletics' Federations (IAAF) needs to be restructured to combat the problem. The report also implicates the IAAF and its former president Lamine Diack, who has been provisionally suspended.

title: REDDIT-73:llama70b-ul2
source:
This fuckup is currently ongoing, as i''m in a burning pain.
About a week ago i felt like my earrings were pretty disgusting so i switched them out with another pair.
Being a dude who hasn''t really worn earrings much in the past i''ve tried cleaning them a bunch of times but they never quite got the clean i wanted them to be.
I figured i''d look into some ways to clean them and after reading something (not really sure where) i settled on peroxide.
My plan was to leave them in the peroxide overnight and then clean them and see how they were in the morning... so i got a yellow plastic disposable cup and then put them in a bit of peroxide and let it go to see in the morning.... i forgot about them for quite a while and tonight, over a week later i decided it was time to take them out.
Being that the peroxide has been exposed to light i didn''t expect much so i kind of just dumped it out and picked up the earrings... without rinsing them.
Now the gauge looks slightly bigger than my replacements so i decided to put one in to see if it fit still, and it did, you''d think that''d be the end of it right?
Wrong.
I put them on the counter and go to bed, about 5 minutes later i feel a burning sensation on my nose.... my hand... my ear?
Seeing as how i''ve had a traumatic week i''m not too worried about it, i feel like i''m just paranoid, so i get up just to check at a leisurely pace and turn on the light.... to see the tip of my nose, and a bit of both my hands bleaching quickly.
Quickly i begin flushing my skin with water and called poison control, who simply suggested keep doing as i have been.
So now part of my skin is mildly bleached, i''m throbbing in pain, and i can''t fall asleep.
Fuck.
summary: A person tried to clean their earrings with peroxide and left them in the solution for over a week. They forgot about the earrings and when they finally took them out, they discovered that the peroxide had leaked onto their skin, causing burning pain and bleaching. They called poison control, who advised them to continue flushing their skin with water. The person is now in pain and unable to sleep.

spans.text: who advised them to continue flushing their skin with water.
when they finally took them out

title: REDDIT-13:gpt4-ul2
source:
So unlike the majority of posts i see here this actually happened today (woah, what!?)
And it left me feeling like i had just ruined the childhood of my cousin.
  so, this fu happened at a casual family breakfast where we had our extended family over.
Anyway, my father asks my uncle, his brother, what he had planned over the easter break and of course as soon as someone mentions easter, the younger kids start getting all excited over the fact that easter is around the corner and about how they're going to "get all the easter eggs and chocolate, even yours, you don't need it you're fat, the easter bunny won't visit you because you don't need them!"
And so on.
Anyway, i find it humorous for about 10 minutes (i should probably mention that i'm not a large fan of young children, i get easily frustrated after too much obnoxiousness, kids man, they can't help it) so i end up going upstairs to my room, unfortunately my cousin ended up following me and continued the tirade of insults, purely innocent and i wasn't the least bit offended by what he was saying, i was laughing along with him but here was where i fucked up.
I ended up saying something along the lines of 'okay that's enough now, how do you know the easter bunny is even real?'
As a joke and i made it clear as soon as i said it that i was just kidding and that if he acts up the easter bunny won't come.
But fuck me man, i'd already done it.
  he then says to me "but if you haven't seen him, then he can't be real....", completely missing the point mind you but his personality is very stubborn and isn't easily swayed.
Once he gets something in his head, it's almost impossible to convince him otherwise.
I didn't know what to say cause i already know what this kid is like and i had just gone and given my aunt and uncle a very difficult task of trying to convince him that there is, in fact, an easter bunny.
He was crying when he came to this conclusion and ran downstairs to his parents telling them his discovery, to which they gave me the biggest death stare i had ever gotten.
To my dismay, he didn't stop there, the next sentence left me feeling like an absolute cunt.
He says "but if there is no easter bunny then santa clause, the tooth fairy and jesus can't be real either!"
(not going to lie, it took everything i had in me not to laugh when he mentioned jesus).
Anyway, the result is that my parents hate me, my aunt and uncle despise me and i doubt anyone in my family will ever speak to me again, guess it's time to revert back to my reclusive existence because family interaction is now a thing of the past.
summary: During a family breakfast gathering, the narrator accidentally sparked doubt in his cousin about the existence of the Easter Bunny by jokingly questioning its reality. The cousin, being stubborn and not easily swayed, then declared the Easter Bunny couldn’t be real, causing a disruption among the family. He further extrapolated the logic to other imaginary figures such as Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy, and Jesus. The mishap resulted in cold treatment from the rest of the family, leading the narrator to ponder reverting back to his former reclusive existence as he feared family interaction might become impossible in the future.

title: XSUM-39664212:gpt4-ul2
source:
Police in germany have charged a man suspected of being behind an attack on the borussia dortmund team bus.
Rather than having links to radical islamism, he was a market trader hoping to make money if the price of shares in the team fell, prosecutors say.
The suspect has been charged with attempted murder, triggering explosions and causing serious physical injury.
He has been  identified only as sergej w, and was staying in the team's hotel overlooking the scene of the attack.
Two people needed medical help after three bombs exploded near the bus.
Spanish footballer marc bartra underwent wrist surgery and a police officer was treated for shock.
Following the attack on 11 april, borussia dortmund's home champions league match against monaco was rescheduled a day later, which led dortmund fans to open their doors to stranded away supporters.
Police initially treated the blast as a terrorist attack.
However, the following week, investigators cast "significant doubt" on jihadist motivations being behind it.
They now say the attack was in fact motivated by financial greed.
Sergej w, 28, would have made about €3.9m euros ($4.2m; £3.2m) from his actions, germany's bild newspaper reported.
In a statement on friday (in german), the german federal prosecutor's office said he has german and russian nationality.
He was arrested on friday near tubingen in rottenburg, south-west germany.
The suspect had allegedly bought 15,000 put options on borussia dortmund shares - reportedly priced at €78,000 (£65,000; $83,600) - betting that they would drop sharply after the attack.
He would have made large profits if the team's share price collapsed.
Experts have likened the alleged plot to a sophisticated form of insider trading - because he tried to use information not widely available to the public to make money quickly.
He was staying at the team's l'arrivée hotel in dortmund on the day of the attack and had moved to a room on the top floor, overlooking the street where it took place, prosecutors say.
The suspect placed the bet on 11 april using an ip address traced to the hotel, after taking out a loan for the money.
Investigators believe three explosive devices packed with metal pins were hidden in a hedge and set off as the bus passed.
The bus was damaged about six miles from the westfalenstadion - officially called signal iduna park - in dortmund about 90 minutes before kick-off.
Pictures from the scene showed its windows broken and its tyres burst.
summary: A man has been charged by police in Germany over the attack on the Borussia Dortmund team bus. However, the motivation for the attack was not terrorism but financial gain, according to investigators. The suspect, known as Sergej W, bought significant numbers of put options on shares in the football team, anticipating that their value would fall following the attack. As a result, he hoped to make approximately €3.9m. Prosecutors have likened the scheme to a sophisticated form of insider trading. The suspect, who was arrested near Tubingen in south-west Germany, has both Russian and German nationality.

title: XSUM-38905952:geminipro-ul2
source:
Super league newcomers leigh centurions have signed hull fc utility back curtis naughton on a season-long loan deal.
The 21-year-old will help cover the loss of james clare, who has a serious knee injury, and the release of lee smith from his contract.
Naughton came through the academy at bradford, and spent a year at sydney roosters before joining hull in 2015.
"bringing in curtis gives him an opportunity to catapult his career at the top level," said coach neil jukes.
summary: Leigh Centurions secure Curtis Naughton from Hull FC on a season-long loan to compensate for injuries and departures. The 21-year-old, who began his career at Bradford, aims to advance his career in the top tier under Coach Neil Jukes.

title: XSUM-29928061:llama7b-ul2
source:
One of the longest-held detainees at the us facility at guantanamo bay, a kuwaiti man, has been sent home, officials say.
Fawzi al-odah, 37, was released after a us review panel concluded he was not a "continuing significant threat".
He had been at the us facility in cuba since 2002 after his arrest in pakistan on suspicion of links to al-qaeda and the taliban - a charge he denies.
He had challenged america's right to detain him in the us supreme court.
Mr odah boarded a kuwaiti government plane on wednesday morning us time.
"there's no bitterness, there's no anger," his lawyer eric lewis was quoted as saying by the associated press news agency.
"there's just excitement and joy that he will be going home."
The release came after guantanamo's periodic review board in july determined "that continued law of war detention of (mr odah) does not remain necessary to protect against a continuing significant threat to the security of the united states".
But he now faces at least a year at a militant rehabilitation centre in kuwait, according to the terms of the release.
The kuwaiti government had pushed hard for the release of all kuwaiti detainees at guantanamo.
Mr odah had argued that he travelled to afghanistan and pakistan to teach the koran and provide humanitarian aid.
He is the first inmate to be freed since may, when five taliban detainees were exchanged for us sgt bowe bergdahl, who had been kept by the insurgents in afghanistan.
Mr odah's release brings down the total number of inmates at the us naval base to 148.
The us opened the facility in january 2002, following the 11 september 2001 attacks in america.
President barack obama has repeatedly promised to shut it down.
summary: A Kuwaiti man, Fawzi al-Odah, who had been held at Guantanamo Bay since 2002, was released after a US review panel determined he was not a continuing threat to the US. He was the first inmate to be freed since May, and his release brings the total number of inmates at the US naval base to 148.

title: REDDIT-78:mistral7b-ul2
source:
Some background information first; i'm in high school so the whole dating thing is kind of new to me.
I've known her for a while but i have just recently started talking to her a good amount the last year.
So the obligatory it didn't happen today, but last october.
So there was this girl i liked.
Let's call her sarah.
So some of my friends have a hunch that i liked her, but i never really admitted it.
I had been debating asking her but i decided against it because i figured it wouldn't end well.
But at home coming, i finally gave in and went for it.
I went up and asked her if she'd want to go see the new (at the time) divergent movie with me on friday.
She was so shocked she had no idea what to say.
She responded to me asking her out with "well i guess i can't say no".
Not a good sign, but at that point i don't care.
My friends are all happy for me and i have a good rest of home coming.
Fast forward to thursday morning, in science class.
The only class i have with her.
She keeps bringing up how she feels like she's going to get sick.
I'm thinking maybe she's just trying to get out of it.
Friday comes and she's not at school.
I tried texting her but no response.
(the next monday i learn she broke her phone) i'm pretty upset at this point.
One of my friends that's known for inviting himself to this sort of thing thinks it's a good idea to invite himself and a few friends.
So we get to the theatre and there i am.
Alone, with no idea where she is or what happened.
My friend who invited himself is having a good time with the people he invited while i sat there eating my candy wanting to leave already.
Now days we're friends and we laugh about it.
Never going to forget this first date.
summary: The document describes the experience of a high school student who recently started talking to a girl named Sarah, who they liked. The student decided to ask Sarah out to see the movie Divergent, but Sarah was shocked and responded with "well I guess I can't say no." Despite this, the student's friends were happy for them and the student had a good rest of homecoming. However, on the day of the date, Sarah became sick and did not show up. The student tried texting her but received no response. A friend who is known for inviting himself to social events joined the student at the theatre, but the student was left alone and felt upset.

title: XSUM-38511385:geminipro-ul2
source:
A woman was tied up and "brutally murdered" by her ex and his partner, who then tried to pass the killing off as a suicide, a jury has heard.
Bethany hill, 20, was found dead with neck injuries in stratford-upon-avon on 3 february last year.
It is alleged she was killed by jack williams, 21, and his girlfriend, kayleigh woods, 23, at the flat they all shared in hertford road.
The pair, who are on trial at warwick crown court, deny murder.
See more stories from across coventry and warwickshire here opening the case, prosecutor stephen linehan qc said miss hill was a former girlfriend of williams and had a "volatile" relationship with woods, a transgender woman with whom she had planned to have a child.
Jurors heard miss hill was found dead by a police officer in a blood-drenched bathroom.
Mr linehan qc told the court: "in the course of the killing, beth's wrists were bound together with duct tape and the blade was used to inflict repeated cuts across the back of her neck before she was killed by the jugular vein being cut through."
He said miss hill was found dead after woods, formerly known as kyle lockwood, dialled 999 at 19:07 gmt on 3 february, telling the operator: "well my best friend is dead in my flat."
Alleging the "sadistic" killing may have been carried out for "perverted pleasure", mr linehan qc said: "what she was saying was that her friend had killed herself while she was out of the flat and that she had returned to find blood everywhere, and that she had cleaned up the flat before making that telephone call.
"all of these things were lies.
Bethany hill had not died as a result of cutting herself - she had been brutally, brutally murdered.
"she [woods] lied because she was one of the two people who took part in the killing and the other person was the defendant jack williams.
Mr linehan said the pair had "set about trying to cover up the truth about what they did" from the moment of the 999 call.
The court heard that miss hill, who was brought up in bidford-on-avon, had a brief relationship with williams as a teenager.
She then moved to stratford to begin a college course, while williams, also from the bidford area, met woods and moved in with her.
Before the alleged killing, the court heard, miss hill had also moved into the flat in hertford road, using the bedroom, while woods and williams slept in the sitting room.
The trial continues.
summary: Bethany Hill, a 20-year-old woman, was found dead in a bathroom with neck injuries in Stratford-upon-Avon, England, on February 3, 2022. Her ex-boyfriend, Jack Williams, 21, and his girlfriend, Kayleigh Woods, 23, are on trial for her murder. Hill had a previous relationship with Williams and a volatile relationship with Woods, with whom she had plans to have a child. The prosecution alleges that Williams and Woods tied Hill's wrists with duct tape, inflicted cuts on the back of her neck, and ultimately killed her by severing her jugular vein.

title: XSUM-37820092:falcon7b-ul2
source:
Shanghai is trialling a unisex public toilet block to lower the time women have to spend waiting in queues, chinese media have reported.
The toilet, in a busy park in pudong new area, will have 10 unisex stalls, plus some urinals and a stall for disabled people.
The opening on 19 november will coincide with world toilet day.
Unisex facilities will spare officials having to decide how to share out male and female stalls, say reports.
"it is an apparent problem that women have to wait in lines for toilets," fu liping, an official involved in the project, was quoted as saying, by the xinhua news agency.
The stalls will be more spacious than regular ones.
To guarantee safety and privacy, there will be attendants and higher partitions between stalls.
But there are no plans yet to build more unisex toilets, as authorities are unsure whether citizens will embrace the idea.
Their caution seem to be well-grounded, as people online have been less than enthusiastic about the unisex lavatory.
"i don't really support the idea.
After all, men and female are different," said weibo user zhu zhu xia.
Another weibo user said: "the problem will be solved if they build double female toilets."
summary: Shanghai is piloting a unisex public toilet block with 10 stalls to improve women's convenience and reduce waiting times during World Toilet Day.

title: REDDIT-6:gpt4-ul2
source:
Little background: i work as a part-time clerk at a grocery store, mostly bagging groceries.
This just happened to me 6 hours ago.
In the last hour of my shift today, i was talking to my coworker about various topics that affect us in our daily lives when a grumpy woman comes through my line.
We start talking about how the store was changed around majorly since the last renovation.
She mentions how she knows five people who don't shop at the store anymore because of this and seems a little frustrated.
I decided to tell her in a dazed manner that most large retail stores don't care if they lose five people so long as they keep getting customers to come in and shop, which i now realize was a complete mistake.
Now i'm waiting until friday to figure out what hr wants to do with me, and now i'm suspended until further notice.
Edit: looks like i still have my job.
Still, i'm looking for a better job.
summary: The document is a personal narrative of an individual who works as a part-time clerk at a grocery store. The writer describes a recent incident where they upset a customer who was expressing frustration about the store's recent renovation. The clerk responded in a manner that suggested the store wasn't concerned about losing a small number of customers. This comment landed them in trouble, resulting in a suspension pending a decision from human resources. The writer has since updated to announce that they retained their job, but are actively searching for a new one.

title: XSUM-31763768:geminipro-ul2
source:
Bestival has revealed an all-female line-up in its second wave of announcements for this year's isle of wight event.
Charli xcx, ella eyre and lianne la havas will appear alongside the chemical brothers and underworld.
Other festivals have been criticised for the lack of women on their bills.
Last week, music blog crack in the road posted images of edited posters removing all the names of male performers.
The rather blank-looking page was shared on social media, with the bills at reading and leeds, download and t in the park also a focus for criticism.
Neneh cherry, andreya triana and radio 1 dj b.traits are among other female acts to be announced by bestival.
Organiser rob da bank said: "there are shed-loads of amazing people making some startlingly good music at the moment and look, lots of them are female."
This year's bestival theme is summer of love.
It takes place at robin hill country park on the isle of wight between 10 and 13 september, with 25 stages on offer.
Follow @bbcnewsbeat on twitter and radio1newsbeat on youtube
summary: Bestival's second wave artist announcements revealed an all-female lineup. The festival has drawn attention for its focus on gender equality, with previous criticism of other festivals for lacking female representation. Artists like Charli XCX, Ella Eyre, and Lianne La Havas will join headliners The Chemical Brothers and Underworld. Bestival's organizer, Rob da Bank, emphasized the abundance of talented female musicians. The festival, themed "Summer of Love," will take place at Robin Hill Country Park from September 10th to 13th, offering 25 stages for a diverse range of acts.

title: XSUM-35862185:geminipro-ul2
source:
England failed to build on the optimism generated by their thrilling victory in germany as they were beaten in a friendly by the netherlands, who have not even qualified for euro 2016.
On a night when wembley paid its respects to the late dutch legend johan cruyff with applause in the 14th minute, a much-changed england side slipped to a rare defeat at the national stadium.
Man-of-the-match jamie vardy rounded off a slick passing move to steer in kyle walker's cross four minutes before the interval - but roy hodgson's side could not protect their lead.
England's defence lived on the edge too often and were eventually punished when a sloppy passage of play led to danny rose handling, and vincent janssen scored from the spot after 50 minutes.
The big striker was then too strong for substitute phil jagielka, although england complained bitterly he had been fouled, before crossing for luciano narsingh to score the winner 13 minutes from  time.
Vardy's transition from the heights he has scaled with leicester city this season to england has been seamless - and he has stepped up a level in the two friendlies against germany and the netherlands.
The 29-year-old has been portrayed as both an ideal starter and the perfect impact substitute as hodgson makes plans for euro 2016.
Vardy has proved his capabilities for both, with an explosive 20-minute cameo in berlin that included a brilliantly instinctive finish as part of england's comeback.
And here, he was england's outstanding performer by some distance, showing the pace and energy that has panicked premier league defences and also skill to round off that passing move with a clinical finish before testing dutch keeper jeroen zoet with a powerful rising drive.
The debate about how best to use vardy may go on but one thing is beyond dispute - he is going to euro 2016 and has the ability to threaten every defence in france.
In an ideal world, everton's john stones would have come in at wembley to produce the sort of elegant display that became his trademark in the early seasons of his career, thus cementing his place alongside chris smalling for england's first euro 2016 game against russia in marseille.
Instead, wembley witnessed a 21-year-old whose confidence has been hit by a recent dip in form at club level and will need a little renovating before the serious action gets under way.
Stones twice brought murmurs of concern from england's fans inside wembley with his tendency to perhaps over-play out of defence, but his determination to be constructive also started the passing move that led to vardy's goal.
The young defender is a work in progress and there will be slips - quite literally when he stumbled at the start of a chain of events that led to england keeper fraser forster having to save well from janssen before rose handled to leave the striker to score from the spot.
Stones is well worth persevering with - but hodgson must hope some of that confidence and composure returns quickly.
Hodgson warned they must not get carried away after victory in germany - and, in case anyone ignored the warning, along comes a defeat against a dutch team that will not even be in france this summer.
In some respects this defeat, albeit with a much-changed side, simply reinforced some of the lessons that came out of the win in germany that was the catalyst for such a surge of optimism.
England have some very exciting options up front in the shape of vardy and harry kane, while daniel sturridge also got a decent 57 minutes under his belt.
Questions remain, however, about a frail-looking defence with both full-back spots still up for grabs and no central-defensive pairing jumping out as hodgson's first choice at this stage.
England certainly carry a threat but fears persist about their ability to resist attacks of the highest calibre.
Fraser forster: solid night for the southampton keeper despite a couple of fumbles.
Saved well from georginio wijnaldum and vincent janssen.
Clear deputy to joe hart.
7.
Kyle walker: solid and quick in defence and a threat in attack with a perfect pass for vardy to score england's goal.
7.
Chris smalling: part of an uncertain central-defensive partnership that once again hinted at england's frailty against attacks possessing real quality.
6.
John stones: not a great night for everton's 21-year-old.
Yes, his determination to play started the move for england's goal but too often caused anxiety with his tendency to overdo things and second-half slip started chain of events that led to the dutch equaliser.
5.
Danny rose: not an easy night for england's defence but rose kept going and may consider himself unlucky to be punished for the handball that led to a penalty.
6.
James milner: anonymous as england's captain.
Milner is a solid presence but not big on inspirational moments.
5.
Danny drinkwater: solid debut from the leicester city midfielder.
Did himself no harm and can be happy with his debut but did he make a compelling case for inclusion in euro 2016?
Not sure.
6.
Ross barkley: busy first half and a trademark second-half surge that set up a chance for adam lallana.
6.
Adam lallana: decent night for the liverpool midfielder.
Clever pass played its part in england's goal and was warmly applauded when substituted.
7.
Daniel sturridge: once he'd stopped fiddling with his bootlaces he settled down and produced one or two moments that hint at the threat he could yet pose for england.
6.
Jamie vardy: england's star man.
Busy, scored one and could have had another.
8.
Substitutes: walcott (for sturridge, 57 minutes): odd flash of pace and one rising shot over the bar but otherwise quiet.
6.
Clyne (for rose, 57 minutes): not much of an opportunity and consequently not much impact.
5.
Kane (for lallana, 70 minutes): just a couple of half-chances but no rescue act from the man who is now england's first-choice striker.
5.
Jagielka (for smalling, 70 minutes): claimed he was fouled by janssen in the lead-up to the winner but should have been stronger in that situation.
5.
Alli (for milner, 82 minutes): no rating.
Dier (for drinkwater, 84 minutes): no rating.
The three lions wait until 21 may to host turkey, while netherlands meet republic of ireland six days later.

Second half ends, england 1, netherlands 2.
